description:
Lincoln (#A1017544) was saved from the ACC's At Risk list as a terribly shy 14 week old kitten.  Lincoln had been found alone, surrendered alone and would have died alone had Place For Cats not intervened to save his dear life.

Lincoln's timidity upon arrival was heart-wrenching.  When held he melted into a little ball of fluff in your hands.  Despite loving care in a few different foster homes, Lincoln remains inordinately shy with people. Lincoln nonetheless has gotten along very, very well with his kitty foster mates in each home.   He is very polite, in cat-speak.  He is not aggressive with other males who are dominant in the household.  Lincoln has been particularly beloved by tiny kittens who come into the foster locations, as he quickly becomes "Uncle" Lincoln to the orphaned babes.  In short, Lincoln is a sweet cat, submissive to other felines, but frankly, absolutely terrified of people.  

Despite serious efforts, Lincoln has not evolved into a lap cat.  Going into a new home, we predict that it will takes months for his new person to earn his trust.  Eventually, Lincoln will sleep on the bed as long as his person doesn't want to cuddle.  Once he is familiar with you, Lincoln allows affection such as brief back & head rubs during meal time but otherwise, to date, has remained too scared of people to allow loving physical interaction.  

Lincoln would do best in a home with a caregiver who would allow him to be his independent self, without obligation to participate in physical interaction.   Lincoln would be happy to be alone in a big house where there might be mice to chase. 

Lincoln is FeLV/FIV negative, current in vaccinations, neutered and micro-chipped.  He is three years old as of January 2018 and has never required treatment for any ailment in the past 3 years.  

Place For Cats welcomes all prospective adopters though we request to have your application in advance of scheduling a meet-and-greet at any of our foster homes.  Our application may be downloaded here:  http://www.placeforcats.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/PFC-Adoption-Application.pdf   Please complete, sign, scan and return to the email address indicated. 

Please note that Place For Cats' Adoption Contract has a NO DeClawing clause.

Adopters agree to a $150 fee and a home visit.
name: Lincoln

description:
ROOSIE (short for ROOSEVELT) is a nice easy-going 1 to 2 year-old rescued boy kitty. ROOSIE has that deep, gentlemanly "meow" that just makes you want to hold him tight and reassure him that all is alright.    

ROOSIE is neutered, micro-chipped, current in vaccinations and FeLV negative.  He is FIV positive but he is NOT sick.  Because he is healthy and asymptomatic it is possible that his former person gave him the FIV vaccination.  That vaccination has resulted in a major backlash because cats who receive it forever after test positive! 

If you would like to meet ROOSIE please contact Place For Cats for an application.  While we are eager to meet all prospective adopters we do need your application in advance of scheduling an appointment with our foster home.  

Should you decide to adopt, please note that Place For Cats' Adoption Contract contains a No Declawing clause.

All adopters agree to an adoption fee and home visit.
name: Roosie

description:
Princess was a bottle baby rescued through ACC's New Hope program.  She has been fostered with Murry and we are interested in placing them as a pair.

Princess has grown into a very smart and healthy adolescent who plays all the time, loves her foster kitty-mate, Murry; and has maintained her sleek appearance even after being spayed.  She has a model's figure - slender and delicate - but she is strong. Princess is agile, figures out difficult high jumps and makes them with ease. 

Princess is FeLV/FIV negative, current in vaccinations, microchipped and spayed.   We prefer that Princess and Murry be adopted together as they have had each other since kittenhood. 

If you would like to meet Princess and Murry, please download our application here: http://www.placeforcats.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/PFC-Adoption-Application.pdf  Please complete, sign, scan and return as a pdf file to placeforcatsinc@verizon.net.  Whhile we are eager to meet all prospective adopters we request your application in advance of scheduling a Meet-and-Greet at Princess' foster home.  

Please note that Place For Cats' adoption contract contains a No Declawing clause.

Adopters agree to a $150 adoption fee and a home visit.
name: Princess

description:
MURRY!!   Oh, we love this adolescent.  Murry was raised with Princess and we are interested in placing them as a pair.

Murry came in with an egregiously ruptured eye.  It took forever for Murry to gain the weight necessary to have eye surgery.  Eye ointment was administered for months before the globe to recede back into the socket before he was ready.  Dr. van der Woerdt at the Animal Medical Center removed what remained of his destroyed eye, and now he is the handsome dude you see in the picture.

As a kitten, Murry had no clue that he was handicapped.  As a highly energetic adolescent he still has no clue that he's missing an eye.  One could not ask for a better adjusted feline.  And, it's impossible to take a bad picture of him, dashing, debonair darling that he is.   Isn't he HANDSOME????

Murry is FeLV/FIV tested negative, neutered, current in vaccinations and micro-chipped.  

If you are interested in meeting Murry and Princess please download our application here: http://www.placeforcats.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/PFC-Adoption-Application.pdf  Please complete, sign, scan and return to placeforcatsinc@verizon.net.  While we want to meet all prospective adopters we request to have your application on file before scheduling an appointment with the foster home.

Please note that Place For Cats' contract contains a No Declawing clause.

Adopters agree to a $150 adoption fee and a home visit.
name: Murry

description:
WINSTON is a strapping youngster whose sweet face will melt your heart.  He was born in our care to a healthy mama kitty and has remained a best friend to his sister, WILHELMINA.  WINSTON is more outgoing, friendly, active and courageous.  His sister is more timid, reserved.  Both have tiny little meows that make you just want to hold them tight and never let them go.

WINSTON & WILHELMINA are healthy, current in vaccinations, FeLV/FIV negative.  They will be microchipped prior to leaving Place For Cats.  Neutering and spaying are included in our adoption package and the kittens either will be done by the time of adoption or the adopter will be offered a choice of dates to bring the kittens into a clinic chosen by Place For Cats for their surgeries with no additional fee to the adopter.  

If you would like to meet WINSTON & WILHELMINA please contact us for an application. description:
Place For Cats pulled TIGER from NYC Animal Care Center's death list.  The sweet, loving boy had a bite of unknown origin which resulted in a Department of Health hold for 6 months.  After much ado, we got the go-ahead to put TIGER into foster care.  TIGER is very friendly, loves to be petted and, according to the ACC intake papers, came from a location where he got along with other animals.   Here is the link to TIGER's earlier profile:  http://nyccats.urgentpodr.org/tiger-17360/

TIGER is now healed of the bite wound, FeLV/FIV tested negative, up to date in vaccinations and neutered.  He has been a champ in foster care.  Part of the DOH 6 month quarantine requires that he have frequent vet checkups all of which he has passed with flying colors.  (Kudos to his foster parents for taking time from work to make the frequent trips to and from the clinic.)  TIGER is available for adoption June, after his quarantine ends. 

While we are eager to meet all prospective adopters, we ask that we have your application in advance of scheduling a meet-and-greet with our foster home(s). You may download the application here: http://www.placeforcats.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/PFC-Adoption-Application.pdf

Please note that Place For Cats' Adoption Contract contains a NO DECLAWING clause.

Adopters agree to a $150 fee and a home visit.
name: Tiger

description:

MARU is 5 years old, spayed, up-to-date in vaccinations, FeLV/FIV negative and will be microchipped prior to adoption.  Her caretaker describes that MARU has an anxious personality that manifests in the presence of strangers or new surroundings.  Therefore, we anticipate a period of adjustment and recommend a quieter, stable home without young children or energetic pets.

description:
At around 1 year old, Raven is an adorable, cuddle baby with tons of energy. She's a goofy character with beautiful markings. She loves playing with her fish on a string, and has learned how to toss around tinfoil recently. After tiring herself out, Raven loves to sleep on your belly, chest, or wrapped around your head. She was rescued from the streets and can take a little time to get used to new people but isn't shy and responds wonderfully to affection (and lots of attention). 

Raven is a very high energy, frisky, active cat and will get herself into mischief if you can't provide her with lots of fun things to do. 

Raven has a mild case of stomatitis. Feline stomatitis is thought to be autoimmune in nature.The feline immune system seems to overreact to dental plaque around a cat's teeth, triggering inflammation in the tissues of the mouth. The problem also occurs on the back of the throat at the oral pharynx, and even underlying bone in the mouth can become inflamed or infected. Stomatitis inflammation appears externally in the mouth as angry, red, swollen tissue.

If you think you can give Raven all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. All of our animals are in foster homes. For the sake of our animals and foster families, you must have an approved application with references before you can meet them. Please do not send inquiries through adoption websites, we do not receive them.

description:
You're my heart, and my heart is yours, is the motto of adorable 10-12 year old, 20lb, Patti LaBelle. Patti was found as a stray and we have no clue how this perfect little lady ended up homeless. Patti is the perfect dog for anyone who enjoys long nights in front of the fire, cuddlefests and treat time. Sheâs also great to take a slow stroll with, happy to say hello to other dogs and loves a day at the beauty parlor. Patti is an easy going dream dog who cannot wait to find her forever home.

Patti has no serious health problems, although she is a little hard of hearing. Being an older lady, she does not jump and needs assistance to get nto furniture and up and down stairs. She is over weight and needed to have 27 of her teeth removed as her dental health was neglected. She would benefit from daily teeth cleaning and dental chews. Managing these two issues will help Patti have many health years ahead of her. Patty should ideally weigh approximately 15 lbs.

Patti enjoys going on walks and needs to continue gentle exercise to help her lose weight, however she is trained to use pee pads and will use them if given access to them.

If you think you can give Patti all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. description:
Meet cute little Winifred, you can call her Winnie or Wednesday or Winnipeg. She is a tiny cat with big personality. Winnie is less than 18 months old, but sheâs already had at least one litter of kittens. Formerly a feral little girl, Winnie was originally spayed with the idea that she would be released back in the area she was trapped, which is why she is rocking that clipped ear. Winnie had often been found scrounging for food and trying to start her own street gang by a friend of Shelter Chicâs. Although she was a diamond in rough, this kind Samaritan trapped her and paid for all the vet expenses out of her own pocket. When Winnie was well enough to return to her old life, our dear friend thought maybe she would give Winnie the choice to see if she would prefer a fresh start as a pampered kitty. Most feral cats have a very hard time making the transition but sweet little Winnie become a house cat almost immediately! She is a smart girl who knows a good opportunity when she sees one ; )

She now loves being inside, and being around other cats. She's is still not a big fan of being held, but she is happy to be around people...especially when they have food. She loves to grab food out of your hands (or swat it down to her level), particularly chicken, and will sleep near your head on the back of the couch when youâre watching tv. She would do best in a home with another cat as she loves curling up next to others, and needs someone who has the patience to work with her on becoming more comfortable with people. 

She is also good with dogs - well certainly not intimidated by them! She has no problem getting into their face and trying to steal food when they are getting a burger or chicken as a special treat. She is very food motivated, which is very helpful to teach her to be more relaxed around people. She will always be the first to check out what everyone is eating.

 Winnie is looking for an experienced cat owner or someone who has other cats and is not looking for a snuggle buddy. Although friendly and keen to be around you, she does not want to cuddle and if that works for you, she will be a great addition to your family, plus she is super stinking cute. :) 

If you think you can give Winnie all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. All of our animals are in foster homes. For the sake of our animals and foster families, you must have an approved application with references before you can meet them. Please do not send inquiries through adoption websites, we do not receive them.

https://www.petstablished.com/pets/public/213317

Please note that 3rd party adoption sites take 6-12 hours to refresh. Allpaws.com and petharbor.com are 4+ months out of date. Please do not apply for animals you see there without checking they are on the Petstablished website first.

description:
Beautiful, 10 year old, 14lb Greysha is a stunningly perfect cat who can make herself at home with any cat lover.

Greysha was bought from a pet shop as a tiny kitten and spent the next 10 years in what she thought was her forever home. When her owner's grandson was diagnosed with asthma, Greysha was taken to the city shelter where she was quickly put on the euthanasia list since she was a senior cat with a cold. 

Scared and alone, Greysha, (who had not seen a vet in 4 years) did surprisingly well at winning over staff and volunteers. Although she can be shy around strangers, she has curious and loving spirit which means that no one is a stranger for long. After hearing her story we couldnât wait to make Greysha a part of the Shelter Chic family and move her into a wonderful foster home where she has been a complete angel.

She loves people of all ages, actively seeking attention and body rubbing against your legs to make sure you know sheâs still there. She enjoys having her coat brushed and is always happy to be picked up and cuddled. She will sleep anywhere, but would prefer to snuggle up next to you at night. She loves tuna as a special treat, (although she does need to lose a few pounds,) and enjoys scratching posts and cat nip toys.

Greysha is a low energy, friendly, affectionate, confident cat who canât wait to find her new forever home.

If you think you can give Greysha all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. All of our animals are in foster homes. For the sake of our animals and foster families, you must have an approved application with references before you can meet them. description:
***PLEASE NOTE, we are unable to receive inquiries about Bobby from external adoption sites. If you are interested in him, please email info@shelterchic.org directly or follow the Petstablished link listed at the bottom of his profile to be considered for adoption. Thank you!

Hey now, Bobby McGee is the sweetest new man about town. Approximately 6 years old and 8 lbs, underweight Bobby needs some extra yummies to get him to his ideal weight.

Bobby is an easy going, low maintenance, quiet, love bug.

Bobby was surrendered to the shelter after his owner found he was throwing up and not using his litter box. Rather than taking Bobby to the vet, they changed his litter, then his brand of food and then gave up. But poor Bobby was trying to tell them that he was in pain. His teeth were in such terrible shape that he could not eat properly and he could not bear to have his face touched.

After a trip to the dentist to get his teeth cleaned, Bobby received a clean bill of health and has been eating and using his litter box without incident.

Bobby only lived with his previous owner for a year before they gave up on him, so we do not know where he came from. Bobby has lived with adults (but no children), he has spent time around two small dogs that he was fine with, as long as they did not bother him. Bobby did not enjoy living with another cat. They would regularly fight, and although this may have been an issue with that particular cat, we believe Bobby would prefer to be the only cat in his home.

Bobby is very gentle and friendly. He likes cuddles, sitting on laps, and catnip toys. Because Bobby is so thin, he is eating a prescription diet to ensure his weight loss is not due to allergies or IBS. He is now steadily gaining weight.

If you think you can give Bobby all the love he deserves and would like to meet him, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. All of our animals are in foster homes. For the sake of our animals and foster families, you must have an approved application with references before you can meet them

In these hot summer months, who doesnt long for a wonderful dose of Spring! A sweet, loving, young lady, who is a little over a year old and 42lbs. She is currently LOVING life in her new foster home, enjoying spending time with her new feline sibling and is delighted to meet all the other dogs in the building.

Spring is still a young pup, but she has clearly had at least one litter of puppies, probably more. She was pitifully shy at the shelter, terrified of everyone but always being so submissive, army crawling to people to get a treat or a head rub. As soon as Spring knew she was safe, she became a different dog. Happy, loving and looking for fun.

Spring would would make a great addition to any active family who likes long walks and runs, is interested in assisting her gain all her confidence back and training her to be a great family member.

description:
Celine Dion is an adorable, mini girl, at around 30 lbs and approximately 1 year old, who has seem some hard times in her short life.

Found as a stray, Celine was taken to city shelter with a terrible cold. Weak and malnourished, it took her almost a month to recover the strength to be put up for a adoption. She joined the Shelter Chic family with an ear infection and some itchy skin, but ready to start a new chapter in her life.

Celine is an absolutely cuddle bug, she adores being with people and loves to snuggle on the couch to watch TV with you. She also loves to play, run and is eager to learn new tricks.

Celine would benefit from some basic training classes and practice meeting new dogs. At the moment she is shy and unsure of herself and although she did wonderfully with her official dog test, occasionally she gets nervous, especially since she is still a little weak and will not socialize with other dogs.

Celine is adjusting well to living in the city, but would ultimately be happier living in the suburbs with a yard of her own.

See more pictures and learn more about Celineâs story on our instagram pages @shelterchic and @shelterchicanimals.

If you think you can give Celine all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. description:
Whitney is an adorable Powderpuff Chinese Crested dog. At around 1 year old, and around 8lbs, Whitney is gentle, happy, loving and absolutely obsessed with people. If she can be glued to your side from now on, she will be very happy.

Whitney is a small, delicate dog who is not suitable for young children or larger dogs who play rough. She will be happiest living with adults and older children who have a lot of time to dedicate to her. Whitney is not a dog who would enjoy being home alone if you work long hours, but she is quite happy to take a nap while you are out running errands. It will be important to show Whitney that being home without you is not a problem and you should frequently leave her for short periods to prevent her from developing separation anxiety. If youâre looking for a dog that will be devoted to you, Whitney is your girl!

As lovers of this breed will know, powderpuff and hairless pups can be born in the same litter, and Whitney is a great example of that, as she has one hairless patch on her back. 

See more pictures and learn more about Whitneyâs story on our instagram pages @shelterchic and @shelterchicanimals.

If you think you can give Whitney all the love she deserves and would like to meet her, please go to Petstablished.com or follow the link below to complete an application to adopt. description:
Age: 5 years
Sex: Female
Breed: DSH

When Animal Haven staff saw a photo of my voluptuous self on the city shelter's website, they knew right away that I was something special and had me transferred to them. Given my rather large frame, I prefer lounging to playing and never turn down a warm bed. I am a sophisticated lady who is looking for a relaxed and quiet home with ample sunlight and treats!

description:
Age: 9 years
Weight: 72lbs

Hi everyone! Iâm Rumple and I am a chill older dude looking for a quiet home to relax in. I was found wandering the streets of NYC with no collar or tags. I was brought to the city shelter but when no one claimed me, Animal Haven decided to take me into their care.

Although I may look âtoughâ with my home-cropped ears, I am really just a gentle giant in need of love. 

 volunteer writes:
Despite his tough looks, scars, and home-cropped ears, Rumple is a gentle, affectionate sweetheart. He is a short, squatty, 9 year old, 70 pound bundle of love. If you sit down next to him, he will give you a kiss, lay his head in your lap and fall asleep. Basically, heâs just a low-key couch-potato, who loves kissing, cuddling, snoozing, snacks, and short walks. Heâs been in the shelter a very long time and needs a home!
name: Rumple

description:
Age: 10 yrs
My name is âWalter Pickle Pantsâ and I am one of the most special, spunky, and gregarious cats you will EVER meet. Animal Haven pulled me from the city shelter, where I had been brought in as a stray. Itâs hard to believe that I had been outdoors fending for myself since I am SUCH a people-friendly cat and was also born with Cerebellar Hypoplasia, a neurological condition in which the cerebellum is smaller than usual or not completely developed. But this only makes me THAT much more charming and charismatic. When I walk around, I look like Iâve had way too much tequila. But as far as I know, I am just like any other cat and donât feel any different.
I get along well with small dogs but would prefer to be the only cat. My ideal home family have someone home most the day since I crave lots of attention!
name: Walter Pickles

description:
Age: 1 year

I am currently in foster care and here is what my foster mom has to say about me:

Meet my new foster, Pani! Pani is a year old and arrived in New York City just [recently] from Iran (yes, Iran!). She was terribly abused and because of that she is now partially paralyzed. Sheâs only been in my care for [a short time], but I can already tell you she is an angel. I love her already! Iâve fostered special needs dogs before, but sheâs my first paralyzed dog. Iâm still learning things like how to put diapers on a dog, and sheâs still learning about getting around with only two working legs, but together I think weâre both going to learn a lot! The great news is that she has some movement in her hind legs and her tail, so we are really hopeful that some of this damage can be reversed. [She already has appointments lined up to see specialist and start water therapy. For now sheâs resting comfortably in my home and learning that sheâs safe and we wonât let anyone hurt her ever again. ?? For more photos and videos, follow @tedisarah on IG.
name: Pani

Hey everyone, Iâm Ari. When I first arrived at Animal Haven I had a broken leg. No one is quite sure how it happened but it was painful and I was pretty scared. Now Iâm all healed up and get around just fine!

Personality wise, Iâm a sensitive guy and a bit shy at first, but once I get to know you I open up enjoy a good chin scratch and get my purr motor running. I love the company of other cats, and help comfort new shy kitties that enter my room. Iâm even gentle with kittens. Yep, Iâm a pretty awesome boy that just needs to find a loving forever home. description:
A ball of fire who does not know the meaning of the concept of fear. Oreo's an active adolescent who needs another active cat to keep him entertained and engaged. He's very social with people too and loves to be on your shoulders and jumps when you are not looking.  He even assisted the folks painting his foster mom's apartment by jumping on the painter's cap. Oreo has been known to race into the hallway and visit with neighbors.  He might greet you with a growl - actually he growls regularly - but it is his way of speaking.  He doesn't seem to understand that growling is usually a negative behavior. 

For more information, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Oreo

description: My foster mom calls me Porky and I respond to that name. I am overweight but the pounds are coming off as I wrestle and chase my buddies. I'm also eating less now that I know the food supply is regular and steady. I do not much like wet food. I can't stand being confined but if you respect that, I make a great companion. My favorite thing is to give hugs. I love to leap into your lap, reach up and rub my cheeks against yours before settling into a lap for petting. My 15 lbs means you will sit still if I am in your lap, but don't worry, my need to explore means that I will jump down soon enough. I'm about 3 years old. For more information, please contact us at adoptions@citycritters.org
name: Poirot

description: Katie was no lady when she first came to us, so we sent her off to âcharm schoolâ where the bigger and bolder cats first ran from her. But they soon started to teach her that growling and aggression are not acceptable. Katie has been a good student, but she has not yet graduated from the program. It is best that she go to a family with experienced cat people and a new feline professor, who is a tough disciplinarian and can tolerate her bitey behavior and teach her to be more gentle. For more information about Katie, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Katie

description: Minnie is an orange-and-white domestic short-hair kittie who lost her home when her owner became allergic. She is an independent cat. She does not like to be picked up by people she does not know but can bond with people she does know. Experienced cat owner is suggested. For more information about Minnie, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Minnie

description: Luna is a friendly, sweet, playful girl who lost her home because her family was moving. She has a mild temperament and is good with people. She also loves to watch TV. For more information about Luna, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Luna

description:
Prince is an agile 9-year-old boy who loves to climb and play; he'll sit on your lap while you watch TV and will also sit on your newspaper while you try to read it.  He's a curious boy, loves watching birds on windowsills and enjoys naps in the warm sun, but he can be vocal and will also let you know when it's play time or when he wants you to sit down so he can lay on your lap!!   

Prince is clean and tidy with his litter, and respects furniture and upholstery. He is sociable with new people, and likes to initiate the contact and to maintain the control of it. 

Like true royalty, he demands your attention, and if you try to make him do something he doesn't want to,  he'll let you know. Not quite Game of Thrones, but not a Disney prince either. He likes space and the ability to explore and roam anywhere he so chooses.

He lost his long-time home when one of the children became extremely allergic to cats. For more information about Prince, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Prince

description: Teeny is our foodie. She LOVES to eat, and food is the best way to make friends with her. Sheâll start off shy, but your patience will pay off as you discover a spectacular companion to play, sleep, and just plain hang out with. For more information about Teeny, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Teeny

description:
Pecan - 1 yr old petite female with some big opinions:

I'm a little girl, sweet as a southern pie, most of the time. I am bouncy and spry, and I love to chase the laser light and dangly toys. I like some petting, a quick massage, but I'm not into a lot of snuggling, and I might swat you away when your time is up. You should know that  I can really get nutty around other cats. I've been around other cats and can definitely say that it's not for me!  But if it's just you and me and you're in to chilling out together after some active playtime, then we will be great companions. For more information about Pecan, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
name: Pecan

description: Here at City Critters we are into energy conservation so we are offering the best solution we can think of to reduce heating costs . . . having TANK sleep beside you. This LARGE boy, a mere 22 lbs, down from 30 lbs, will keep you warm and snuggly. He's a content guy, good with children, friendly to your guests, and "exercises" only to chase a piece of kibble if you toss a snack. He has tolerated kittens in the past but he's not too keen on sharing with adult cats. Do you have too much space in your bed?  Tank is ready to fill the void. For more information about Tank, please email us at adoptions@citycritters.org.
