description:
Preble, NY 13141 

"Hello, everyone! My name is TONY. I am a 4 year old, 53 pound Pit/Boxer mix.

I was already past due to be put down at a kill-shelter in New York City, when I was miraculously saved by a rescue because of a kind lady who offered to foster me. 

I completed a 6 week training class at PetSmart, and even received a diploma! I know sit, stay, lay down, come, wait, crate, drop it, leave it, and take it. I am crate-trained and walk well on a leash. My foster mom says I am VERY smart and that I learn quickly. I have lots of energy, so a home with a good sized yard or a quiet, nearby park would be best. 

Despite what I have been through, people are my favorite! I am a VERY affectionate boy. I love to sit close and snuggle. I love to throw myself over your lap and get my head and ears rubbed. 

Because of my past, I am fearful of stranger dogs, but please donât let that deter you from adding me to your family! At my foster home, there are three other dogs who live there, and although I was afraid of them at first, they no longer scare me and we can live in harmony. It is believed that I do not like cats though, and a home with older children would probably be best because sometimes I get a little excited and like to jump.

I hope to meet you soon!"

Love,
Tony ?

Tony is neutered, up-to-date on vaccinations, and micro-chipped.

----------------------------------------------

To learn more about Tony, email AmsterDog at amsterdog@gmail.com or apply to adopt at http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/ .

Thank you for caring about a dog in need!
name: TONY - 4 y/o Boxer-Pittie Mix

description:
Pittie, needs a Home!
New Hartford, NY, Oneida County

DARLIN' - A name, a term of endearmentâ¦.so deserved for this sweet 55 lb, 2 year old girl. Surrendered to our care when her person lost their home, Darlin' lost everything too â her person, her home, her safety. Sheâs an amazing dog who is not only housetrained, she heads to the edge of the sidewalk to take care of her business. 

Her leash manners are good; she pulls only when there is a new scent that canât wait to be investigated. Darlin comes with rockstar comments from her former person: sheâs friendly to all people, loves kids, loves baths and will jump into the tub on her own, loves dogs of both genders but prefers males to females, is not a fan of kitties, sleeps on her own bed but will sometimes sneak onto her personâs bed in the middle of the night, loves to jump and give kisses, loves belly rubs, and knows sit (âput it downâ). 

"I loved my time with this sweetheart â she is everything her former owner said and more. Sheâs gorgeous, sweet, playful, snuggly, takes treats gently, has a great smile and gorgeous eyes, is beautifully groomed, loved playing with a plush toy, posed for photos like a pro. Seriously, if you are still reading this and not rushing over to meet her you are missing out on a gem. Darlin' â her name and a very deserved term of endearment, but donât just take my word for itâ¦..see for yourself."

Darlin is spayed, up to date on shots, and microchipped. This happy, healthy, darling girl DARLIN is ready to meet you! ?

--------------------------------------------------------------
To learn more about Darlin', please contact AmsterDog at amsterdog@gmail.com, or fill out our online application at http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/ .

Thank you for caring about a pet in need!
name: Darlin'

description:
Philly, PA - Meet Jesse, a 4 year old 46 lb. Labrador/Border Collie Mix who is house broken, crate trained, neutered, up to date with all the shots, good with other dogs if properly introduced, (never tested with cats, but it will do if requested.)
From Jesse's devoted foster mom:
"Jesse came from the ACC in Manhattan where he was in the list to be destroyed. We are so glad that Jesse was rescued, but Jesse needs a special home where people can give him time to trust and not rush things. Jesse is very sweet, but needs patience and respect for his need to take things slowly. 
Jesse is a very unique dog, his personality is great! He talks to you all the time and if he is bored he will mumble around, like an old man, but he is anything but old! I think he is a lot of fun! Although he does not like to be grabbed (still), Jesse is sweet and likes to cuddle. He is very athletic so he would be a great companion for jogging, running or hiking. He would do excellent in agility. He is good on a leash and knows Sit, Stay, Give Paw, Down and Roll Over! Such a smart boy! 
Jesse would well in a home with children 10 years of age and up. To meet Jesse, please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414
name: Jesse

description:
Fort Lee, NJ 

Meet Bernie! Recent two time death row survivor who was sprung from his cell and is now out livin' and lovin' life! Loves people, good with dogs, great on his walks, house trained and a very lovable boy. Bernie is in training and is proving to be an A +++ student! He is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped too. He'd love to come home with you and be your Best Forever Friend! For more info on our boy Bernie, please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414, and thanks for caring about a dog in need!
name: Bernie

description: Western PA Oh, Mr. Sandman bring me a dream, make him the cutest I've ever seen....that's exactly what you'll be singing when you meet our best brindle boy...4 year old Dream. Unfortunately for this sweet boy, someone woke him up from his dream of a forever home and ! boy, it wasn't pretty. Like that bf or gf that tells you they love you but always cancels plans, I just went through a break up with a family that didn't treat me well. When we met, I was a fit and well built 62 lb. boy. Unfortunately they must've been too busy to realize how skinny I was getting and weren't giving me all the love and care I deserve. I was about half the weight I should have been when they took me away from those people.... Luckily my lifesavers at AmsterDog have one of their angels, Tracy, taking care of me and working their magic. My life is a lot different and by different, I mean better! I'm gaining weight and having so much fun with all the animals at Aunt Tracy's house. And now they're all playing Cupid to make sure I find my true love...AKA my forever family. Not to mention they're helping me get my doggy curves back so I look good for them. So forget about chocolates and flowers, a new doggie is the ultimate gift. I'm pottytrained, love other dogs, cool with cats and big kids. I am also an expert cuddler. Also, really good on a leash. Just ask the shelter volunteers, my current super foster and anyone who has ever met me. Also, I am gosh darn adorable! So come and meet me. Let's make our first date one for the books! By the way, I am neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped too. To meet me, contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414. Thanks for caring about me! XO Dream
name: Dream

description:
**MIDNIGHT** ONCE A BAIT DOG, NOW A LOVE BUG!***
As if this poor little munchkin hasn't been through enough, lovely MIDNIGHT is losing her foster home, evicted by the landlord!  Kearny, New Jersey 07032*** Editor's Note: If my tiny apartment was even ten square feet bigger and not already at pet capacity, you wouldn't be reading this because I would scoop this dream girl up in a second. Hopefully your place is bigger than mine because our newest AmsterDog, Midnight, is absolutely amazing. Pretty as a picture and sweet as a stack of pancakes, Midnight is cuddly, affectionate, housebroken, smart-- we're sensing a theme here. Yes, she is just about perfect but one thing is missing, her forever home. Which she had since she was a puppy but her owner had some human problems that doggies don't understand so they dropped her off at the shelter. Luckily a superhero swooped in to save her and foster her. Now they're on the search for her forever home. Midnight lived with three big dogs, a kid, is not aggressive with her food and loves getting outside for her exercise and saying What's Up to fellow dogs. Midnight likes a proper introduction to other dogs and wants you to know she loves cuddles but is a little shy at first. Midnight has probably seen some stuff but that hasn't stopped her from being a loving little bunny. So stop thinking about it because yes, owning a dog is freaking awesome and yes, if you already own one you are so ready for another. Don't miss out on Midnight! Midnight is a pretty pittie girl rescued from the city shelter on 6/17/17 who was lucky enough to find a doting foster home to take her in and help save her life. Midnight's foster tells us she is a super sweet girl and while she may be a bit shy at first, it didn't take anytime at all for her to be comfortable with her new family. Midnight is up to date on shots, spayed and chipped. Please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414 to learn more about Midnight
name: Midnight - FOSTER OR ADOPTER IS NEEDED URGENTLY!...

description: Four year old, 56 lb Buster Tige! A volunteer writes: I stumbled across Bubâs Match.com ad: âMe: Single, white and grey male, good looking but need a little TLC for my coat. I love to take walks and meet new people. My tail is always wagging, and I love treats and take them gently. Iâm polite with female dogs Iâve met in my temporary home, and havenât yet been paired with a male for playgroup. The best thing about me is that Iâm a super cuddler, happiest when rolling into my person, giving kisses, and generally just being close. Iâm told I have a great smile, and gorgeous, intelligent eyes. Iâm a lover, and looking for my soul mate, so if you think weâre a good match, letâs meet. More marriages were made on Match, so letâs add to the statistics! You: Looking for a white and grey male, good looking, and a super cuddler for a lifetime of love and snuggles.â Volunteer comment: Bub is a doll, and if a sweet, fun loving partner is your ideal four-legged companion, Bub would love to meet you. He loves treats, so will be easy to train with positive reinforcement (treats!!). I fell in love; you will too. Another volunteer writes: Wiggle, wag, wiggle, wagâthatâs the greeting youâll get when you approach Bubâs kennel. Ready to rush out the door to go potty, heâs then ready for some hugs, some play, and some fun. Lively is the hallmark of his personality, with lots of timeout for cuddling. Bub is hoping a fun, active and affectionate family or person is ready to make him theirs. From Bub's devoted Foster Mom: He is all about being a LOVER. He was a total schmooze in PetSmart, while we bought him some new clothes and treats. Such a schmooze, he convinced the lady in line in front of us to open her treats before she paid for them So she could treat him, while he sat so nicely for her. :) This handsome devil is looking for a home, so any of my connected friends, let me know, and please share the heck out him!
name: Buster Tige

description: Desi is a beautiful and elegant dog, very Labbish looking, standing on high legs and flapping ears around his pixie face. Desi is always ready for a walk and is leashed at once. He lets you know that he is happy to be in your company . He is so obedient, wags his tail non stop, sits on command, with or without treats, and loves caresses. He enjoys sitting on the bench or just sitting on his caretakerâs lapâ¦ Desi has so much needed love to catch up on. He walks well on the leash Desi is a very endearing young dog with soft manners, very affectionate and who has caught the heart of many. Will you, please, give this wonderful and sweet boy a chance?
name: Desi

description: Richmond, VA. **** Who's the cutest dumpling on the planet? C A R R I E, that's who! Who's got personality plus? C A R R I E, that's who! Carrie's former owners obviously thought she was pretty enough to be bred over and again, and when she could no longer produce puppies at 10 years old, they dumped her off at the city shelter. Shame on them, but their loss is our gain, because Carrie is a doll! To know her is to love her~ She loves going for an easy walk, is completely housetrained, loves playing with toys, and the bottom line is, she has no idea how to act like the 'senior' she is. Good for her! Carrie has enjoyed her playgroups with both males and females, offering correction when mounted. Atta girl! A treat lover (she didn't get that pleasantly plump figure for no reason), I'll get a quick woof if I'm not fast enough, and her adorable jowls get all jangly. Carrie is the consummate traveler and loves car rides, sleeping in hotels and let's not forget room service! She's an absolute delight who will be the best couch potato ever. After a walk and some play, that is. Carrie is 70 lbs, up to date on shots, chipped and ready to find her forever home. Please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414 and thanks for caring about a sweet senior in need!
name: Carrie

description: Alexandria, VA 22310***** This AmsterDog will have you saying âThank you, thank you very muchâ just like the legendary singer he was named after. Say hello to Elvis, who may not pull off a white sequin jumpsuit the way Mr. Presley did, but is just as handsome and sure to steal your achey breaky heart. Just like The King, Elvis is all about LOVE. He is super kissy, cuddly, snuggly and quality time with his family gets him glowing. While he loves to be the main act, he is great with other friendly dogs but likes a proper introduction. No fangirling too fast. But we can't blame a dog for tryin', because just look at this adorable low rider! Elvis loves long walks and getting out into the world and while heâs sweet as can be, house broken and a great boy in the house he could use some work on his leash pulling. Heâs also SO happy to be out of the shelter heâs working on some separation anxiety when humans leave but getting better every day because his awesome foster family is letting him know heâs safe and that scary shelter is his past and his future is a forever family that will cherish this hunk and all the happiness he brings. Elvis is a man's kinda man, and loves to hang with the guys; give him football, some basketball and popcorn---he's all IN. However, he has been known to entertain the ladies. Itâs clear to say this guy is loving life and can make you laugh just by looking at that amazing mug. So come meet Elvis and heâll having you singing the Kingâs classic, âWise men say, only fools rush in, but I canât help falling in love with you.â We just know it! Elvis is an incredibly happy 3 year old, 68 pound pit bull mix, formerly known as Snow. He is neutered, up to date on shots and chipped. To meet him please contact his rescue Amsterdog at 917 689 8414. And thanks for caring about a dog in need!
name: Elvis

description: KIRBY 5 yr old Blue Nosed Pittie~Cuddling is his forte, ******Woodbury, CT 06798******An energetic five-year-old, this bright-eyed, floppy-eared sweetheart will still your heart with just one look. With a gorgeous silver coat and a kind, generous attitude, Kirby, fka Crimson, is perfect on the outside and in. He is right there with you on long walks, but, once you get him home, he is perfectly calm. He loves and charms every person he meets (even the vet staff!), wants to give kisses and wiggles to all, and hugs if you like them, and allows all kinds of handling. All he asks for is a soft bed for snuggles, a chew toy, and a human to love. He loves nothing more than to chew his bone or a rubber ball while you sit by his side. Oh, and he gives as much as he gets â giving kisses and getting scratches and belly rubs. Heâs a dogâs dog, a 50 lb. terrier mix who will perfectly fill that dog-sized hole in your heart. He was found in a city shelter and rescued the day he was set to be euthanized. He wasnât in the best shape at first. He had pneumonia, raw paws from tough days alone on the streets of New York, and a skin infection. But his loving foster parents nursed him back to perfect health, and now he is ready for his new life to begin. Perfectly housetrained and healthy, Kirby will be great in a house or small apartment. He has been through a lot in his young life, but heâs all set for his next adventure â a forever home!! Kirby is neutered and fully vetted. Please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414 to meet Kirby~
name: Kirby

description: Northfield, Massachusetts. Nine is Divine! It means that at 9 years old, I'm perky, happy, and love to go for walks. But then, I chill and take nice long naps. My foster mom says I checked out fine at the vet & am ready for a fur-ever home. Woo hoo! The ideal adopter knows how to go slow and doesnât have small, active children. I am blind in one eye so quick movements around my head are confusing. If you're in a rush and open the door quickly, I might bump my head. It takes me a little while to warm up but then I'm your best friend, your companion. Your sidekick! I want more walking and playtime than with my original family. Too much alone time makes me chew on my tail sometimes. I whine for a few minutes when you leave me alone but then I settle in and take a nice, long nap. I'm incredibly house-broken but enjoy 3 good potty breaks plus a nice walk. Around the block here in Western Massachusetts is a couple of miles so I like to walk briskly alternating with sniff & piddle for 30-40 minutes. I'm currently 23 lbs, a few lbs over what I should be. My foster mom thinks good food, play, and exercise will take care of that. I don't have a lot of experience with other dogs but I'm well-behaved when I meet them. Mostly I ignore them, especially the boisterous youngster types. I also met a cat and was very curious but the cat hissed & jumped out of the way when I leaned in for a good, long sniff. Do you need a sidekick? Are you a good pet parent? Do you have a great vet like who can check my weight, lumps & bumps, and eyes & ears each year? Then, ask my foster mom about meeting me. Minnie is up to date on shots, spayed, microchipped, housebroken and all ready to meet you! Please consider adopting this sweet senior girl! AmsterDog's adoption application can be found at: http://amsterdog.org/adoptionfoster-application/ You can follow me on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/AmsterDogMinnie/
name: Minnie

description: Sickersville, NJ *** Two year old Gizmo is a very handsome young man, a red head, quite poised. He has been outstandingly cared for by his former owners, being of perfect weight at 53 lbs and wearing a most beautiful coat. He lived harmoniously with older children, was friendly and outgoing with all, playful with dogs his size (timid with small ones) and very playful. Gizmo is quite sociable, a good walker who seems to like other dogs, gentle, giving standing hugs, happy to be petted and very playful with the ball or a toy. He seems to like to keep them for himself, so we just exchange one toy for another, slipping a treat here and there as a reward for good behavior. I forgot to say that Gizmo is a very good sitter, taking duck jerkies quite politely from my hand. I really like Gizmo, a very good looking young lad, friendly and so playful. If you have the talent or the time to improve his training, Gizmo will make a very nice and loving pet for an active owner. Gizmo is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. To meet this really great guy, please contact 917 689 8414 or fill out our online application at www.amsterdog.org. Thanks for caring about a dog in need!
name: Gizmo

description: **Hyde Park, MA 02136** Valentineâs Day may be a few weeks away but our sweet vanilla and butterscotch Sasha is ready to steal your heart TODAY. Just one look into those baby brown eyes and next thing you know youâre in love. This 6 year old AmsterDog is a pretty little lady with a big heart and even bigger dreams. You see, she was emaciated at 24 lbs. when animal control found her, but she is now all filled out and healthy. At night, when Sasha is sleeping, she dreams of her forever family. She sees herself cuddling with them, reassuring her that she is home because sheâs a smart, sensitive lady that just needs a reminder that âItâs OK!â. She sees herself sneaking naps with her humans when they doze off watching their favorite shows. Sheâs not picky about her choice of TV but we have feeling Sasha is a fan of rom coms. She sees a whole room full of tennis balls (ok maybe just a basket) and playing catch with her family. Sasha loves her naps, but this lady likes her exercise too. Wow, this is one long dream because Sasha also sees just a few furry friends. After all she went through we think she would be better in a home where sheâs one of the few animals or a pretty chill environment. She might be OK with a bigger crew after a while but she is still unwinding from that scary city shelter. Sasha sees giving and getting lots of love from her family and being silly at the same time. Sasha might not see this in her dream, but we had to add that she is occasionally guarding her food slightly. An easy adjustment but hey, who wouldnât be like âHands off my mealâ if you didnât know where your next meal was coming from. This dream sounds pretty sweet so letâs make it come true for this beautiful pup and come fall in love with Sasha! Sasha is spayed, up to date on shots and microchipped. To meet this sweet girl, please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414 and Thanks! for caring about a sweet girl in need!
name: Sasha

description: BOB - 8 years young, 51 lbs Bob is neutered, up to date with shot, and microchipped. If you would like to meet this friendly guy, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414. A volunteer writes: One of my all time favorite movies is What About Bob? and if I were to make a version about this Bob, it would have to be Whatâs Not to Love About Bob? He might be middle-aged, but youâd never guess it, and he is cute as can be. He was shy at first with me, but still very easy to handle, and even nerves canât stop his sweetness from shining through. He is easy to walk on leash, seems to have housetraining, and is very treat-motivated (he already knows basic commands, too!). He loves toys, and although he has been nervous around other dogs in our playgroups, he has been very tolerant, and is even used as a greeter dog. He warms up to solicit affection, and is really lovely company! Words from Bobâs foster mom: He's a very happy easy going dog, he reminds me of a golden retriever. He likes to lay out on the floor like a frog, root through his toy box, sit next to his dog friend, and follow any human he sees. He is very smart and knows a lot of commands including agility. He is great and just sits calmly for bath, nails, and ear cleaning! He's always happy and just thinks humans are the greatest! Low energy but if you wanted to play he would def rally and play. VIDEO: https://youtu.be/aS29ZfNHoDo Bob is neutered, up to date on shots, microchipped and all ready to find his forever home! Please contact AmsterDog at amsterdog@gmail.com to learn more about awesome Bob!
name: BOB

description: SLADE - 2 years old, 41 lbs Manhattan *** Sweet Gentle affection seeking Slade arrived at the shelter with blunt force trauma wounds all over his poor little body. Slade is a little guy that seems to have hit a rough patch, but even though he's a little banged up he is as cute and sweet as can be! He is very friendly, frequently props his paws up for attention, and wags his tail when you talk to him. He is house-trained, likes treats, but most importantly likes to spend his time next to you. He's looking for a place to heal and a family to love... From his foster mom: "A bouncy compact bundle of joy whos tail has not stopped wagging since the minute he walked in our door. Despite the fact of the obvious cruelty, there is not a mean bone in this little guy's body. When you see the injuries on his sweet face and that vulnerable small stature it makes you wonder how someone could be so heartless. Just to watch him can warm the coldest of heartsâ¦ He is so spectacular that in only hours he has taken our lives by storm! Yet after A full day of bouncing, kissing, making the world a better place, he hits his bed hard and floats off to dreamland! This boy loves to sleep! And sleep he does! Once it's lights out, he means it. Considering he weighs only 41 pounds, I can assure you that 40 pounds of it is all heart! He deserves the best Home in the world! He's taken our breath away and deserves nothing less than perfection. Whoever would be lucky and blessed enough to have this kind hearted sweet face gentle lamb in their life has certainly won the lottery." Slade is neutered, microchipped and up to date on shots. If you would like to meet this love bug, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414
name: SLADE

description: Jersey City, NJ**HARLEM, 1.5 years old, 39 lbs - One-and-a-half year old HARLEM is seeking his forever home! His foster Mom says Harlem is a cuddly boy, always looking to stay close. He loves going on walks, barely ever pulling, and has been friendly with both large and small breed dogs while on-leash in the park, constantly wagging his tail. Harlem previously lived with an 11 year old child and has graciously accepted petting from children in our apartment building. He also previously lived with a cat! Harlem is an awesome companion to share your time with! Harlem is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet this handsome fella, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414. He is the cutest little peanut you have ever seen! ??
name: HARLEM

description: BRUCE - 5 years old, 76 lbs Bruce would do best in a home without cats and as a single dog at this time. His foster parents write: Bruce likes long walks where he can sniff out pray and enjoys his butt scratched 24 hours a day. He enjoys to snack on apples, T-bone steaks, hamburger and all sorts of yummy things. But likes his vegetables also! Bruce loves to play but I recommend no indoor playing as he gets very excited and energetic! He is an exuberant love bug and deserves the best home and I hope with some teenage kids that he can run & play with. Even though Bruce is very strong he can be gentle as well and takes treats nice of your hand. Bruce needs time to warm up but is learning to give kisses and loves giving hugs. Bruce is amazing and super duper wonderful and deserves the best home! Bruce is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you are interested in meeting this adventurous pal, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414
name: BRUCE

description: Rockaway Beach, NY***** Happy Chinese New Year! Itâs the Year of the Dog, our favorite! And one AmsterDog in particular is ready to get the party started. Say hello to 5 year old 54 lb. Papo, our sweet, beautiful Sharpei. Or shall we say SharPapo since he is his own breed of cute. Dumplings have crinkles but Papo has wrinkles that make him deliciously adorable. Papoâs ancestry is said to be linked to the Han Dynasty and even go as far back as 206 BC but he is a modern day love bug! Weâre guessing emperors liked to cuddle when they wernât busy ruling the world because Papo is a natural at it and so affectionate, playful and loving. Heâs also a good boy of regal standards when youâre not home, loves spending time with his human friends, will love you even more when he gets his toys and bones and, weâre not sure how far back leashes go but he really know how to strut his stuff on walks, catching everyoneâs eye. Papo has a lot to celebrate in addition to the New Year. We saved him from the shelter where he ended for no fault of his own and then had to have surgery on his eyelids. But now, heâs recovering great because heâs so excited every time we tell him about his place called Forever Home. We canât say enough about this guy, probably because we are obsessed with how cute his wrinkles are. But what we can tell you, is that Papo would give up the parades, fireworks, and even cake to know he is finally home and loved. That sounds like the best celebration of all. ***** To learn more about Papo, please contact AmsterDog at 917 689 8414, email amsterdog@gmail.com, or PM us here on Facebook. Thank you for caring about a pet in need!
name: PAPO

description: JACKIE, 2 yrs old, 53 lbs. Jack fka Jackie is available for adoption! This wonderful boy is super friendly, loving, and affectionate. Cuddling is his forte and so is sitting for treats:) Jack is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet this sweet boy, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414. Thank you ?? Volunteer writes: Jackie joined us with a large wound to his back leg, requiring immediate care to clean and suture it. Heâs quiet in his kennel, and as I opened his door his tail wagged a hello. Stepping out carefully weâre out the door and Jackieâs first priority is going potty. We donât walk far as I donât want to hurt his leg so we spent time petting, enjoying treats and sweet talk. As gentle as a lamb describes Jackie at this point during which must be such an uncomfortable and confusing time. Medical staff tells me what a nice dog heâs been during treatments and he certainly is. âSweet and friendlyâ is how theyâve described him and Iâd say that fits him perfectly. Heâs also a bit underweight, and despite that took my offered treats so gently. Like people, dogs recuperate and heal more quickly in a home environment and weâd love for Jackie to find his healing place quickly. Heâs a sweetheart who responds so well to love, and is ready to share it with his new person. Jackieâs Videos: https://youtu.be/pVslLlBXSaE https://youtu.be/0Q7ZXDtIBwk https://youtu.be/Xff5ZDzkYA8
name: JACKIE

description:
12 Photos Â· Updated 3 years ago
Queens, NY - ****Update: 12/3/17**** Freddy is now staying at a vet hospital while we look for a foster home for him. Here is what his advocate and sponsor had to say about him : "I managed to arrive a couple of minutes before Mathew brought Frodo in. He immediately made himself at home: jumping at everybody and kissing everybody. He is extremely outgoing, friendly and sweet dog. He came with scratched nose and sides of lips. I could lift him, hold him, put ointment on the scratches. He is very young and has a lot of energy of course. Thus I had to steady him by holding his muzzle to put ointment on â no problem at all. His accommodations are very good: the hospital is very warm, he has separate room with huge crate (good enough for a Great Dane), I provided two comforters, two soft wide collers, two leashes, a sweater and a coat. There are other animals in the hospital overnight too. I walked him longer than an hour yesterday night and today morning. We will continue this schedule of walking. I am taking it easy: he learned âwaitâ quickly so I can pick his poop up and let cars and people pass (not so many in this area). Making him walk together with me will be of course harder job. I do not request for dogs to truly heal but they should not ever be in front or in back of me â we should walk together side by side with them sniffing and etc. I will have pictures taken during the week-end: too much going on now. There is a possibility of foster round the corner from me. But I am taking everything one step at a time. The hospital personnel is very compassionate and experienced with rescue. They loved him from the first sight. They will take good care of him for now. I think he will get a lot of attention and will be much happier there. He is very small and I think he is a pedigree: a true pit with stance and body type â just miniature. I have seen some like that: the owners told me that they are called âBulli pitsâ. I will check it out." Stay tuned for more on Freddy Frodo! A volunteer writes: Hello up there, new human friend! My nameâs Frodo, this is my chew toy, and weâre on the hunt for an adventureâ¦wanna come with me? Iâm a lot like that other Frodo you know, pint-sized, innocent and true of heart, I even have furry feet like him! My whole outlook on life is can-do and I donât have a beef with anyone. See how I meet passing people and dogs with tail wags and a wigglebutt? Thatâs just me being me, I am full of love! Iâm also full of energy and nothing makes me happier than getting my zoomie on in the yard, playing fetch or just running around with my peeps. I never guard my things, though I play a pretty good game of tug-o-war, and I always keep my mouth what they call âsoftâ so no one gets hurtânot even the toys! Cuddles are cool too and if you try to kiss me, guess what? Iâm gonna kiss you right back. So whaddya say? You, me, my chew toy and endless adventures full of snuggles and fun? I canât wait to have you as my new sidekick so please say yes. Pretty pretty please with dog treats on top? Freddy is about 2 years old and is a petite 43lbs.
name: FREDDY

description: HAVEN, 2 years old, 66 lbs, Verplanck NY Now there is rarely a boy as handsome as our Haven. He is sooo stunning! You can believe me when I tell you that his album photos do him no justice. This chap is even better looking in person! But rest assured her is not just a pretty face! He is very smart and has such a nice temperament. Haven adores people and children and would like to spend every moment with you (not in a clingy way!) He is quite the athlete and loves all sports - hiking, fetch, run, you name it. Our supermodel likes other dogs and gets along with kitties too! Hurry to meet him at the Westchester Canine Center. He is a gem! Haven is neutered, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet this handsome fella, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414. ?? A volunteer writes: Haven lets you know that he does not belong to a kennel. He enjoys being with people. He loves to play ball or run in the park. He is quite a handsome and athletic young dog and very pleasant to spend time with. He is a great walker(I was so wrong thinking that he could be a major puller), not a bird or squirrel chaser and although interested, he is respectful of other pooches met on the way. He seems to be house trained, of course. Haven is a little anxious(he has gotten better) and spending his energy at fetching and retrieving balls in the yard is right up his alley. I like that he brings back the ball right at my feet, lets me pick it up and waits for the throw. He can jump very high and even twirl in the air. Haven samples treats politely , sits on command and even gives paw. He might be a big and strong guy but he does know that he can find comfort and love in his caretaker, accepting caresses and hugs. Haven is a very good looking dog, energetic, friendly and playful , working in sync with his caretaker. Beside some fine tuning to make him yours, adopting Haven will get you a great companion and forever best friend. Haven Videos: https://youtu.be/CHWmN30sCIo https://youtu.be/A5T9IuNG9Bw https://youtu.be/ueNPC9JHvuQ https://youtu.be/pe0OSPEmcws https://youtu.be/KDy9ilzYmeo
name: HAVEN

description: MAMA, 6 years old, 42 lbs, Verplanck NY Beautiful brindle Mama is available for adoption! She is a sweet girl, can be a bit shy initially but opens up very quickly to show off the loving and affectionate gal that she really is. Mamaâs is soft and social in a group setting. She does well matching the energy of the other dogs; exploring the pens with calm dogs, and engaging in play with bouncy ones. The Behavior Department recommends that Mama be placed in a home with resident dogs that match her sociability. Mama is spayed, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet our lovely Mama, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414. ?? Mama Video: https://youtu.be/VsHCdi_qiBY
name: MAMA

description: SCULLY (now Rosie) - 3 years old, 62 lbs, Waxhaw, NC My name used to be Scully but my foster mama calls me Rosie. I am currently being fostered in NC after being surrendered to a kill shelter in December, right before Christmas no less. I'm a boxer pittie mix and am almost three years old. My ideal home would be with an active person/couple as I have lots of energy. If you have a fenced in backyard even better! I love, love, love to run and play but still need to learn to come back to you. Off leash is a no no without a fence. I adore long walks and light hiking. I can probably be trained for longer hikes and to go on a morning run with you! I have allergies to chicken and fleas and am on a special diet and medication presently. My foster mom is transitioning me to a limited ingredient commercial diet. Seems to be working fine and my allergies are in check. I'm am so easy peasy to medicate - you can drop it on top of my food or give it to me rolled in cheese. I LOVE cheese. Really, I do. Oh, I also love organic apples, baby carrots and bananas. My foster mom gives me these as treats. Unfortunately I am not a cat lover so a home with NO CATS is required. I am iffy with other dogs. Some I like. Some I don't. I am the girl boss after all. I would LOVE to be your one and only. I was surrendered from a home with small children, one small dog and two ferrets because the landlord said I had to go. I do have a loud bark. Maybe it was that? I'm shy at first and need a week or two to settle in. And for some reason I am a lap dog. Or, at least I think I should be. I have the most soulful eyes and give lots of kisses. I can shake and am decent on a leash, regular and retractable. A volunteer writes: Scully. Without her Mulder? Looking up for UFOâs? Maybe. Miss Scully started off as scared in her kennel, as this isnât what she knows. She knows her former family of 2 adults, 2 young children and 2 ferrets, her soft bed, a full food bowl (sheâs allergic to chicken), and covers to hide under if thereâs a thunder storm. Scully is finally persuaded that Iâm a friend, and once out, goes potty (weâre told sheâs housetrained), shows me nice leash manners, and then off leash in the back joins me on the bench for some petting. Pleasantly plump, sheâs been fed with love, her coat clean and groomed. Scully enjoys treats, taking them gently, gives kisses through the fence at a dog in an adjoining pen, and while still a bit anxious at this upheaval in her life, is making friends and coming out of her shell. Weâre told she can be shy with strangers at first, and weâre all strangers, so this is a lot for this beautiful girl to deal with. And sheâs dealing just fine, figuring it out step by step. I donât do change well either, so I get Miss Scully and how brave sheâs being. Scully is a proven family girl, and even liked licking the ferrets, so letâs get this little girl into a new home so she can once again have a family to love and take care of. A volunteer updates: Thatâs my girl! Scully saw me approach, her tail starts to wag and she came forward to be leashed. (She licked the ferrets she lived with, I still love that about her!) Sheâs figured out the routine, knows that people with leashes are friends ready to take her out for a walk and sheâs a happy girl. Off leash, some zoomies, some bounces, some tail wags and a big smile; sheâs happy to be out to stretch her legs and go potty. Sheâs such a beautiful dog, she takes my breath away as I watch her scamper through the pen. Sheâs ready to be part of a loving family again, and all she needs is for you to meet her and say âsheâs the oneâ, and take her home. Youâll want to, trust me. Scully Video: https://youtu.be/OHpcwMICooY https://youtu.be/xcbqdrsip0U
name: SCULLY

description:
Garden City, Long Island - IVY - 4 years old, 53 lbs, Needs Solo Dog Home

Ivy is available for adoption! 

Spring has sprung! The roses, tulips and magnolia are all about to bloom but we're really excited about Ivy, our gorgeous, goofy, grey and white girl. We think Ivy must be part love bug because she is soooooo sweet and people are her favorite thing in this world. Like maybe even more than treats and bones. 

While Ivy's got a 24/7 grin now we rescued her right in time from a shelter that doesn't make any dog smile when they think about it. But thank goodness we did because she's dreaming of her forever home where she gets to give her humans tons of love and get lots of loving right back. We think Ivy would be best as the only dog in the house for now. And while spring flings sound fun, Ivy's love doesn't just last all year round but forever in fact.  So come meet amazing Ivy today. 

Ivy is spayed, up to date on shots and microchipped. If you would like to meet Ivy, please contact AmsterDog at 917-689-8414.
name: LADY IVY

description:
Lady is a 2 year old darling that loves going on walks (she's good on the leash) and adorably looks up periodically to her handler to check in and she equally loves a good couch cuddle. She's a gentle soul who has been around children and does very well with them.

This adorable, smiley gal has had a rough start but is now flourishing. Now all she needs is a loving forever home. 
Lady would do great as a family dog as she adores humans of all sizes. 

She would prefer a home where she is the only pet.
Lady is in good health, spayed and up to date on all her shots.
Inquire about Lady today!
name: Lady

description:
Pringle, a 10 year old love of a cat. He is a major a head-butter and all-around loverboy.  He has never encountered a human hand or leg he wouldnât rub his adorable little body against. He also loves lolling around and rolling over to give you his belly. Pringle is a diabetic kitty so he is on insulin. He takes is injections like a champ. He really is a remarkably gentle cat. His foster says he's the only cat she's had that didn't put up a fight when she clipped his nails. He's simply amazing

 Pringle is good with all people, cats and dogs. and would make a great family pet. This sweet senior deserves an amazing home. How about yours?
name: Pringle

description: Lucky is a gentle, refined girl with an endearing personality. Under 3 years old, she acts playful like a kitten sometimes, while other times displays her regal demeanor. Lucky is a pretty grey tabby with a cute white marking on her muzzle. She is living harmoniously with other cats and a small gentle dog. While she takes time to warm up, once she does, she's all yours. She loves sleeping in bed with her person and hopes to find a home where she is allowed in her humanâs bed at night. While not a lap cat, she likes to sit by her person while they watch TV. Lucky absolutely loves head scratches and will quietly purr to show her contentment. She would be happiest with someone who would like a very affectionate cat.
name: Lucky (Good with cats and dogs)

description:
Axel is truly the head-butting champion of the world. When she popped out of her carrier after arriving at her foster home. she rubbed her sweet little face against her foster momma's. She is super friendly and follows her foster mom all over the house. When she's not exploring, she is cuddling up as cute as can be on the bed. She also cutely gazes out the window checking the action of the world outside. But, she's not a layabout by any means. She loves to play with toys and is constantly exploring. 

Axel has beautiful swirls all over her chubby little body (she's around 12 lbs) which she proudly displays as she lounges on the floor like the princess she is.

She is a truly wonderful gal who would do great as a family kitty, Inquire about het today.
name: Axel

description:
Beau is such a precious little guy. This two year old, stunning, sleek jet black kitty is independent, curious and playful. 

He's an agile kitty exploring high-up places like on top of the fridge, taking a stroll on cabinet tops and doing a tight-rope walk along the head board of the bed.

Beau likes toys and lounging on kitty and human beds. And he's so handsome with striking yellow eyes and his shiny coat truly make him something to behold. 

Beau would do best as the only pet in the home. He isn't the cat that will cuddle on your lap, but he promises to be your loyal companion.
name: Beau

description:
Looking for the perfect kitty? Well, meet Giovanni a 2-year-old Tuxedo who loves all people and animals. He's a major cuddle bug who immediately won the hearts of his foster family. As soon has he arrived they sent us pics of how great he settled right in and how thrilled they were to have him in their home. 

He's great with dogs, cats all people and will make the perfect family pet. He's a true lap cat with a heart of gold and the folks lucky enough to adopt him will fall head over paws.
name: Giovanni

description:
Like his namesake, Romeo is a real lover. He is a sweet and gentle kitty who really adores his humans seeking attention, pets and love regularly. This  7 year old sure loves a good scratch, that's for sure. He's incredibly good natured and quite curious. He enjoys going on little excursions about the house exploring. Its rather charming, 

He was rescued from the city shelter where he instantly became a staff favorite because of his friendly demeanor. He really is a special little guy.

Oh, sweet Romeo. We know where thou art, but where for shall thou go? Perhaps to you, lucky reader?
name: Romeo

description:
Meet Hamlet, the purring machine. This sweet and affectionate cat loves attention and offers major headbutts constantly. He a seriously playful guy and one of those goofy cats who has sudden bursts of energy and zips around the house. 

He does pretty well with other cats. He's super playful with them too, so he would need an equally active buddy. And older mellow cat would probably not be a good fit.

As he can get a little overstimulated while playing, he should not go to a home with young kids. But an experienced cat family who understand highly playful energetic kitties will have the reward of a lifetime. Plus, he's so darn cute.
name: Hamlet

description: Plum is simply a wonderful cat. This 4-year-old charmer is curious, sweet, affectionate and playful. And while she does love her toys, she's a pretty chill cat most of the time. We think she's make a great family cat as she's so well mannered. If you are looking for great companion kitty, Plum would be a perfect fit. Come and meet her today,
name: Plum

description:
Walter wants to be your best friend. If you sit down, he sits next to or frequently you will find him in your lap. If you lay, he snuggles right up next to you for a nap. A genuine purr machine, his motor starts going as soon as you pet him or brush him which he loves.

He's always curious as to what you are up to and if you walk out of the room he is sure to follow. And when he's not wrestling with his toys, you can find him gazing out the window checking out what;s going on outside.

Walter found as a stray in his foster's backyard hanging out with the other ferals. He looked a little sickly and when the foster went to check him out, she discovered how friendly he was.  And after some vet care, he's ready to go. This guy is a gem. Come and meet him today!
name: Walter

description:
You simply will not find a sweeter kitty than Alicia, This 4-year-old stunning Tabby has got it all. She's outgoing, affectionate, cuddly, playful and curious. She checks all the boxes! She follows her foster mom around and dives in for a snuggle session whenever someone is on the couch. We think she would make a great family cat as she is good with everyone she meets. Kids would love her personality right back. 

We reached out to the NYC shelter saying we had room for a kitty and she was the first one they suggested because of her winning demeanor. She was a staff favorite!

Come and meet this fantastic feline today!!
name: Alicia

description:
Gosh, you just want to pick Penny up and put her in your pocket and take her everywhere. This adorable 5-year-old Chihuahua/Beagle mix is the happiest, goofiest, cuddliest pup you could meet. She just adores life! She's always down for a stroll in the park and loves mixing it up with other dogs. In fact, ideally, she would go to a home with another pooch because she loves the companionship so much. She's great with kids too.

Penny is just dying to wiggle her way into your heart. Come and meet this precious pup today!

Penny is spayed, UTD on shots and housebroken.
name: Penny

description:
Sweet Brando came to us under sad circumstances. He was the housemate of a kitty to gentleman who sadly suddenly passed away. We got a call and of course had to help Brando as well as our other kitty. This 4 year old is such a lovely cat who has adjusted very well to being in a new foster home. 

Brando is cuddly, affectionate, and playful. A curious little soul who loves people and gets along well with other cats.. Come and meet this wonderful kitty today.
name: Brando

description: Skittles is just the sweetest lap cat around.  She loves jumping up on your lap for a good chin scratch and will stay with you all day long.  She is a very low energy low maintenance lady who is happy to just lounge in bed and be pampered! She has plenty of spunk and likes to check out whats going on around the house but mostly she just loves being loved!  Skittles is currently living with other cats and a dog who she is adjusting to very quickly!  She's very calm and while she can be a little scared of new places at first she loves people!  Skittles would be a great addition to most any home! We believe Skittles is about 10 years young.  She is healthy and up to date on her vaccinations.  Just the purrrrfect kitty!
name: Skittles

description:
Are you looking for a cuddle cat? Well, look no further. Chuck is the real deal. This 5 year old is the ultimate love bug. He's cool with being snuggled but he's likely to snuggle you first! He gives endless kneading sessions to your lap and likes to sleep right next to you. Do we really need to say more because we can.

He was a favorite at the vet because he's so well behaved, He did amazingly well on the transport from the NYC kill shelter and has won the hearts of everyone he's met. So you if you want to adopt a family friendly, ideal kitty, come meet Chuck. You won't be able to resist him!
name: Chuck

description:
Oscar is no grouch! Quite the opposite. This 1 year old is a head butting machine who loves hanging out with people. He settled right in to his foster home hanging with with their young daughter (we think he's a great family cat). 

While he was at the city shelter, we was a staff favorite saying he enjoyed attention, was easy to handle and liked being petted. HIs foster absolutely loves him and we think you will too.

Oscar can be a bit dominant with other cats so he should probably be the only kitty in the house. Come meet Oscar today!
name: Oscar

description:
We can learn a lot from dogs. Winter in particular. This 2 year old amazing pup was rescued from a horrendous situation in the Bronx where she was starved and neglected by the people who had her. Additionally, she was tethered most of the day. She rail thin and in dire need need of medical care. Hard to imagine how anyone could do this do a dog, but it happens all too frequently. 

But Winter has moved on completely. She is a wonderful, chill dog who loves the company of people and dogs alike. Among her favorite activities is sitting by her fosters side at outdoor cafes checking out the passers by, going on walks `with her foster dog sister and sidling up to her foster dad for a good cuddle session. Winter holds no grudges from her previous life. If we could all be so forgiving, the world would be a better place. We bet your world would be better if it included Winter. Inquire about her today.
name: Winter

description:
Sweet Haze is the kind of dog who is a little shy at first, but once he knows you, you've got a friend for life. He was a family dog who was surrendered to the city shelter because his caretaker became ill and could no longer care for him. So, after living his whole 7 years with one family he wound up in strange surroundings. But the volunteers fell for him writing:

We volunteers were talking about Haze and agreed that he was such a pleasant dog to walk and spend time with. He is cute, too, medium sized, so silky, well groomed, well nourished and dressed a bit like a chipmunk. Haze is a gently mannered dog who is with us as his ailing owner could not care for a pet anymore. Haze is a good walker and minds his business with birds, squirrels, and other dogs. He is obedient, comes when called, sits on command and hops with help on the bench for cuddles. Haze was a bit hesitant at the beginning of our encounter, but a few minutes into our time together, the ice was broken. 

Haze needs a loving patient home who can earn his confidence which will yield undying love and cuddles. He deserves a second chance. Could it be with you?
name: Haze

description:
Melody wins the hearts of everyone she meets. She is a super endearing, gentle 12-year-old Beagle mix who is all smiles and love. Melody is a chill lass who wants nothing more than to hang out with her people. She doesn't need long walks. She much prefers a nice lap to curl up in.

She's a bit of a chunky monkey and could stand to lose a few pounds. She must have been overfed in her previous home -- and who could resist a face like that asking for more?!

Melody was a favorite at the NYC shelter where we rescued her from and we know you will fall in love as quickly as they did. Inquire about Melody today!

description: Gin and Tonic (aka Ginny and Tonny)  are one year old sisters (as of May 2018).  It is their heartfelt desire to spend the rest of their lives in a loving home together.  Tonny (with the full mustache) is the more outgoing and adventurous with Ginny holding back a bit and following her lead. The girls were born on a cow farm and taken by their emaciated and clever Mom to live in quiet shed which was frighteningly close to a busy roadside.  Mom knew enough to elicit help for herself and her kittens and the family was eventually taken in by caring humans.  Mom and the other siblings have found permanent homes and now it's time for Gin and Tonic!  The girls have been fostered with other felines, dogs, and multiple humans and get on well with everyone.  Should you be interested in learning more about becoming their forever family please call Julia at 518-249-4588.

The woman wanted him killed because he wasn't spending enough time on her lap and had knocked some of her precious objects off a self.  Zeke is a perfect kitten and he does kitten things.  Additionally he has a magnificently long tail with a kink at the tip!  Please watch his video clip and should you think he might be an appropriate addition to your family call his foster mom Julia at 518-249-4588.

description:
Meet Kevin and Patty>>>

Kevin is a 1.5 yr old lab/boxer mix and is full of love. He was pulled him from the euthanasia list within minutes of his âtimeâ. He is a sweetheart and loves to play. Kevin is so excited to play that he loses all of his manners while doing so. His new home needs to be with someone who can work with him on his manners. He loves walks, he loves to be held as he does feel he is a lap dog. He does not seem to mind that he is 60 lbsâ¦he thinks he is fine in your lap or near it. He is a big baby. He will need a fenced in yard. He is of course neutered and utd on all shots. Kevin has been Pattyâs best friend since he met her. It seems Patty was abused. She is very very shy and the sweetest girl and so gentle. She is afraid of most men. It has taken her a long time to come out of her shell but she now wags her tail and smiles a bit, Kevin is her anchor. When she saw Kevin for the first time- she was eager to meet him and he has helped her with so many of her fears. They are so good together, now they run and play all the time Patty is so comfortable around him. They really really should be adopted together. We are hoping for a home for the two of them with a yard so they can run and play.

.

These boys just need a new place to hang out. They are all low maintenance- they came from a senior who was sick and whose home unfortunately we not fit for human nor animal to live. Timothy(light orange with cinnamon nose) is about 6 - 8 yrs old. He is just a love - sweet, friendly, vocal. He LOVES people. He enjoys playing with his toys and being brushed. Oscar is about 7-9 yrs old. He is a bit more subdued. Sweet and quiet. He sometimes does his own thing but loves hanging with his buddy Bob. He is people friendly but a little more aloof. Heâs got spunk, loves to play with kitty toys. Meows but no sound comes out:0 and sometimes he has a little cattitude but he still looks for affection and enjoys being pet.

Here are 3 loving boys that need you.

Meet Jenny and Missy

They were pulled from local shelter where they found themselves brought in as âstraysâ . They seem to be mother daughter or sisters we are unsure but are bonded. Both are very very sweet.

Jenny is about 10ish and is both visually and hearing impaired. She has some arthritic issues as well but is very content walking around the yard a bit and laying in the sun. She seems to be a Chinese crested powder puff., a very sweet little girl.

Missy is younger- maybe 8 or so; she is a bit more active than Jenny but again, very very sweet. She too enjoys her time in the yard and enjoys spending time with Jenny. She is a bit more playful than Jenny. Both are as sweet as can be. She is a mix. Missy will be having her eye removed next week.

description:
Meet Fern! Fern is a 10 year old, 8lb spayed Chihuahua.

Fern is a chill, quiet little pup that loves dogs (especially other Chihuahuas) and amazingly, she loves cats! Fern was in a high kill shelter for almost 2 months then went to our longtime trusted foster but had no luck finding her forever home. Now she's got a new foster mom who has been gentle and gave her some time adjusting. Here's what she has to say about our senior girlfriend: 

- I would say her mood is ''silly" (in a cute way!). 

- She jumps and wags her tail a lot and it's "party time" when i get home 

- Sometimes she talks back to me (in a cute way), and i really think she believes she is speaking ''human'' 

- She is quite energetic for her age and loves to play "running up and down the long hallway.'' 

- She is stand-off (ish) at first, though within the past week has become more affectionate and will sit in my lap and allow me to hold her. 

- Sometimes she will sleep in the bed with me, but other times she prefers to sleep in the dog bed next to my bed. 

- She follows me everywhere in the house, like a little shadow. 

- She is GREAT with the cat! 

- Loves vegetables and fruits- even green peppers

-Uses the wee wee pad (most of the time!)

Fern will do best in an enviroment with no children, since she requires some handling experience. If you think you can offer her a fantastic environment in her golden years, we urge you to apply!

Fern was rescued in LA as part of our Waggy West rescue mission to bring At Risk dogs, one by one to NYC for adoption! We are always looking for volunteer chaperones to bring at risk dogs like her with them on their next LA-NYC flight, we pay the dog's ticket and provide a carrier! Email waggytailwest@gmail.com if you can help!

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! description:
Jerry is an 8 year old, 10lb Yorkie! 

Jerry might take a while to warm up to new people, but once he does he loves his belly rubs and being pet! He enjoys going on walks and is well behaved on the leash. 

Jerry has some issues resource guarding toys so we would recommend that he not be allowed to have them, with gradual introduction with positive reinforcement that it's good to share. He is treat motivated so he think with work she should be able to overcome this. We would recommend an all adult home with experienced adopters willing to give him the time and attention he deserves!

Jerry is up to date on vaccines, microchipped and neutered. He has also had a dental cleaning.

Daisy is very sweet. She is easy to handle and loves to be close to her humans, she is a big cuddle bug and lives for belly rubs! Daisy walks well on leash and would love to have an active owner! Sheâd be an excellent companion to explore the city with, and she's mini enough to stick in your bag and go! Daisy gets along with most other dogs but sheâs not fond of cats. She is house-broken to go outside, yet knows how to use wee-wee pads if she has to. 

Daisy sometimes resource gaurds her food, but this is a behavior that can be easily modified with positive training methods and a bit of patience! She is living happily with two other small dogs. 

Daisy is up to date on shots, microchipped and spayed.

Ladybug came to NYC on 5/27 from a rural Texas shelter ... she's a little cutie! 

Ladybug is a female Chi-ler (#chihuahua/#Heeler mix). She is about 1-2 years old and 20lb. She is shy but once she gets some gentle love and affection she warms up and is affectionate. She is small and adorable, up to date on shots, spayed and chipped. She seems to be ok around cats, and housebroken as long as she's on a schedule. She does not like staying in a crate! She is playful, but not with toys. She'd rather play with clothes (a girlie girl). Let's get her adopted so she can be dressed up and prance around and show her beautiful self off.

description:
Diamond is a 5-6 year old, 6.8 pound spayed female Chihuahua / Mini Pincher! Just look at her petite frame and sweet chestnut eyes. She is looking for her forever home in NYC as she just flew here to the big apple from Los Angeles.

Diamond is incredibly sweet with sultry eyes. Everyone who meets her falls in love with how quickly she snuggles up in your arms. She is very much a lady when it comes to everything she does. She adapts to any situation from cuddling in her bed, to going out shopping and even subways. She is always eager to go on car rides and sits patiently in her car seat throughout the ride. Sheâs a shy dame because she was recently surrendered to the shelter, so she needs a little TLC and has a little separation anxiety because she is heartbroken. She does well with other dogs and doesnât shy away from children. She is house-broken to go outside. She is quiet and a non-barker, but at times does whine when her human is not near. She is learning to find comfort in being alone and peanut butter is definitely her comfort food. 

Diamond gets along with dogs and cats.

Diamond is up to date on shots and microchipped. She is scheduled to be spayed July 12th.

Diamond was rescued in LA as part of our Waggy West rescue mission to bring At Risk dogs, one by one to NYC for adoption! We are always looking for volunteer chaperones to bring at risk dogs like him with them on their next LA-NYC flight, we pay the dog's ticket and provide a carrier! description:
Chico is a 12 year old, 8lb Chihuahua mix. Our fabulous senior looking for his forever home!

He would be the perfect addition to a home that already has a fur baby. He gets along with everyone he comes across. He is a big fan of being pet... Forget to give him a nice scratch behind the ears?? Donât worry... Chico will not hesitate to remind you that scratches are to be had. Chico also enjoys getting a good belly rub.

His fosters are currently working on basic commands, but Chico has shown an affinity to spinning when he knows there is a treat waiting. He enjoys going on walks: at least four a day. He has a very healthy appetite, so we ensure that he gets his kibble in smaller, more frequent meals. He is quiet and mellow, medium to low energy.

Chico is up to date on shots, chipped, neutered and just had his dental done recently.

As for humans, she is the perfect companion animal. She cuddles, sheâs great in the car and in a bag, sheâs not a huge barker and sheâs super soft and funny and will follow you around. description:
Jerry Stiller is a 7 year old, 7 lb Chihuahua!

This little guy is a bit timid, he wants to be loved and warms up more quickly to men. That said he is his foster mom's little shadow and likes to fllow her around the apartment checking up on what she's doing, and is gentely asking to be pet now he has built up some trust! Jerry has lived with another dog before and we would love for him to be adopted into a home with another pup who can show him the doggy ropes. He has also spent some time around children and was fine around calm kids.

Jerry is currently polishing up his potty training and is doing well using pee pads when he is kept in a small space to do his business.

Jerry came to us as an owner surrender in Los Angeles from what may have been a breeding/hoarding situation. With love, patience and a doggy sidekick we hope he will blossom into a sweet and loving companion!

Jerry is up to date on shots, chipped and neutered. He had a dental cleaning in Los Angeles before he flew to NYC where he is now looking for his forever people!

description:
Charlie is a 6 year old, 6lb neutered male Chihuahua! He is up-to-date on shots and microchipped.

Charlie is a total love bug. This little guy loves people, other dogs, and even cats. He is very quiet (never barks) and his foster reports that the only time she has heard him make a noise was when he was woofing in his sleep! Charlie follows his human everywhere, and his favorite thing to do is be close to his person. If you're looking for a sweet little shadow, look no further. 

 At the moment he is eating a special veterinary diet that will help him with his digestive system. He had some unexpected health issues, and he is on the mend and we are looking for an adopter who will carefully keep to a strict diet and potty routine. All this little pup wants is a warm lap and a relaxed, loving home! Please ask about this for more information. 

Charlie should go to a home with another friendly dog. He loves being around dogs and he loves to snuggle. He gets along with cats and children, too! Charlie is currently fostered with two senior chihuahuas and fits right into the pack. He will be the perfect addition to your home (and pack!)

Charlie was rescued in LA as part of our Waggy West rescue mission to bring At Risk dogs, one by one to NYC for adoption! Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: James Dean *check back 7-16*

description:
Meet Rhylee! This 1.5 year old and scruffy fun moppet from LA who arrived in NYC in June to find his forever home. He's a happy loverboy who gives a lot of kisses and is happy to snuggle in your lap. We think he's about 7 lbs, so he's a perfect apartment dog. He is listed as being 1.5 but his foster thinks he's younger since his teeth are so white and his energy is so bright! He gets along great with his foster dog and cat siblings, and has an energetic classic puppy personality. He loves to play with toys and loves to cuddle, and falls asleep as soon as you lay him on his back haha! He wants plenty of love and attention, and we think he would be an amazing choice for someone looking for a family pet.

He is up to date on shots and has just been neutered.

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.comFosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.comPLEASE NOTE: Dogs marked "Adoption Pending" have an approved adoption application on file and are awaiting final approval. Please check back in a few days to see if they are still available!We understand you may have questions but the fastest way to get answers is to fill out the application and the foster parent can answer any questions you may have!Waggytail Rescue CAN NOT guarantee the final size of any of our puppies! If you are concerned about the size of your adopted dog, please consider adopting one of our adults who need you.
name: Rhylee

description:
Meet Ty! He is an energetic and playful 1 year old, 39lb blue heeler.

Ty, true to his breed, is go! go! go! He loves to run and play fetch, and to have a good romp with other dogs. He is ideally looking for a home that will give him the exercise he needs to burn off all that cattle dog energy! Ty is a smart pup, he knows his name and is learning basic obedience in his foster home.

Ty would make a great family pet for an active household. He has lived with kids and other dogs and gets on well with them. He takes his lead from opther pups so we would love if he could find a home with a furry sibling. He walks well on his leash and is housebroken.

Ty is up to date on shots, microchipped and neutered!

description:
Franklin is a 1 year old, 9lb Chihuahua! He is up to date on shots, chipped and neutered. Franklin is currently with a foster who is thinking of adopting so please check back after 7/8 to see if he is still available for adoption!

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! description:
Toby is a 2 year old, 12lb Chihuahua mix! He is currently in a shelter and needs a foster to get out! Fostering is a great way to help a dog in need and fosters have priority in adoption!

Toby is a sweet pup who enjoys a comfy lap to snuggle on! He has not previously lived with other animals but he been greeting the dogs at the shelter with a lot of interest and a neutral body position. He is housebroken and loves a good squeaky toy!

Toby has previously lived with older children (10 years plus) and was relaxed around them, however think he would do best in an adult home as small kids make him nervous and defensive. He can be a bit nervous when new people come into the home but with treats and sniffs he quickly become comfortable. He is up to date on shots, microchipped and neutered.

Please contact us DIRECTLY using the instructions below if you are interested in fostering or adopting one of our Waggytails! Visit our website (www.waggytailrescue.org) for an adoption or foster application on the CONTACT US page. It is important to fill out an application as soon as possible for consideration, and we require a complete application for you to meet an animal. Simply attach your completed application to an email with the dog's name in the title, and send to:

Adoptions: waggyadopt@gmail.com

Fosters: waggyvolunteer@gmail.com
