name: Toby! FOSTER NEEDED!

description:
How is it possible that only recently, the exuberant, beautiful Zoey, abandoned by her owner at a high kill shelter, was leaning against the legs of volunteers because she was too weak to stand on her own? Utterly disoriented that after her 1 year old life in the comfort of a home, she was suddenly on her own, facing certain death? Now, rescued into a foster home and fully recovered, she runs and leaps and bounds and jumps into the air as if the air were itself a playmate. She spreads kisses among humans and dogs as Jackson Pollack scattered paint, wildly and beautifully. She loves dogs, she loves people, she loves butterflies, she loves blades of grass...this beautiful spotted Brindle girl is in love with it all, in love with love. In the shelter, she was so depressed we were concerned about her survival; we are equally and utterly convinced that now, she knows she has been given a second lease on life, and she isn't missing a second of it. The only thing that Zoey IS still missing is constant and dependable, forever companionship, with another human, and perhaps another animal...she isn't picky. But she is a wonderful dog who craves a place to belong, a person and/or animal to pay attention to, to play with, with whom to play. We have given Zoey a chance at another life. Please  give this glorious pup, who is overflowing with delight and love and goodness, a chance to share her love with others.

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Zoey

description:
Everyone-whether you are a person, a cat, or a dog- should have a playmate, and everyone's mate should be as playful as adorable Sandrine! She loves people and is great around cats and dogs. This two-year-old girl, who weighs 53 pounds, was rescued off the euth list at a high kill shelter and is now lighting up her foster home with her sense of humor, her endless desire to shower all around her with kisses, and her ceaselessly wagging tail. Sandrine loves other dogs as much as she loves people, she's great with cats, and she'd she is wonderful about sharing her food and her toys with all around her. Sandrine is a gift that keeps on giving love, love, love--a perfect addition to any family that she might call her own forever!
Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Sandrine

description:
There's no one who doesn't love Malibu, and when it comes to love, this wonderful, warm boy is indiscriminate: He adores people, cats, and dogs. Recently rescued from a high kill shelter, the 2 year old is thriving in his foster home, where he has learned his basic commands in record time and impressed everyone with his perfect energy level--high enough to be filled with joy on a walk (he's great on a leash), but low enough to make him a wonderful companion to hang out with while you read (he's a superb snuggler). Malibu's an easy, great boy who is longing for a forever home. His needs are simple: Someone who will play with him, walk him, and love him. With a dog like this, it couldn't be easier!
Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Malibu

description:
Being able to share the life of Riley is one of the greatest pleasures, and it pains us that we are only temporary caregivers of this extraordinary dog...but how thrilled we are for the family lucky enough to adopt him! This 2 year-old, who was rescued from a high kill shelter, is no less than a genius. A genius, we tell you! He knows how to roll over, sit, like down, and shake. And he knows how to make people laugh--he has such a wonderful, playful spirit. Riley is beloved by all who meet him, but it is the person who meets him who can offer him a forever home who is looking at a life of Riley-happiness.Â  Could you be so lucky??
Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com
name: Riley the superstar!!

description:
This 3 year-old love muffin is summed up perfectly by his temporary caretaker, who says with a giant, affectionate smile on her face, âHe is beautiful and busy!â This cute, 39 pound sweetheart was on the euth list at a high-kill shelter after being found as a stray. Immediately, he won the hearts of volunteers with his hilarious anticsâhe will do anything to make people laugh, and once he finds something that works, whether playing ball, or enthusiastically scratching his back on the grass, he will keep it upâand soon after was rescued by a wonderful foster. Benjamin Franklin adores his canine foster siblings, and is so smart heâs already learning his basic commands. He is curious, and loving, and an absolute joy to be with. His enormous heart is matched by his energy level, and while he is never obnoxious, Franklin would be happiest with a family whoâregardless of how small their homeâwould be able to give him regular exercise. In exchange, this sweetheart will offer up a lifetime of hilarious laughter and unending love.


Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Benjamin Franklin

description: Lil Blue is an infectiously funny 1 1/2 year old girl who shows a little bit of a working drive: Need your tennis ball fetched? Check. Your sheep herded? Very possible. Short of that, a tennis ball will do. Lil Blue has a lovely confidence about her which makes her an easy match with a family (or anyone, for that matter), as long as that family does not include a cat. She's got a weak spot for confident male dogs, although she is equally good with female dogs as well! Lil Blue will make a wonderful addition to a home; she is funny, kind, and has a sense of self that is simply enchanting. Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: LIttle Blue

description:
Bio coming soon

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Samburu

description:
Bio coming soon

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Babar

description:
Max Massimo came to us from a high kill shelter simply as "Max," but as our love has grown for this 1 year-old Great Dane mix (and how could it not?), so has his name. This incredibly sweet boy loves to play with everyone--people, dogs--and his caretakers describe him as "not having one mean bone in his body." And let us add how adorable that body is! He is compliant, he is kind, and while he is currently being professionally trained, occasionally his exuberance still gets the best of him with a jump for joy. He'll do great in the city, he'll do great in the country, he'll do great with dogs of all sizes and humans with hearts almost as big as his, if only because it's hard to imagine anyone's whose heart is this giant!

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Max

description:
Bio coming soon !

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Ghena Dream

description:
Here's how extraordinary this 6 year-old family dog is: One of her caretakers in the high kill shelter where she was surrendered tried to adopt her but ultimately wasn't able to because of housing issues. Needless to say, these kennel officers see dogs day in and day out, so to be so moved by a resident as to try to adopt her means a dog is spectacular. And Treasure is exactly that--an unbelievable find! She formerly lived with and loved a cat as well as a dog, she adores playing with animals and humans of all sizes, showing notable gentleness around children. She is house trained, loves to share her toys, enjoys her bath, doesn't mind getting a mani/pedi, and knows how to "sit" and "come." But her favorite, favorite pastimes are getting her belly rubbed and hanging out with her family, two things she doesn't have much of a chance to indulge in while she is in foster care, awaiting her forever home. It's hard to know who will be luckier when you all unite, your family or Treasure, but we would be so delighted to call it a win/win! Please, don't make this girl wait another moment for a lifetime of tummy rubs and romping!

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Treasure

description: Our beloved Niala is all heart (and beautiful eyes! She has the most beautiful eyes!) She's a one-dog argument that eyes are the window of the soul because she is just a magical, kind, loving, warm dog....looking for her forever home. Niala was rescued from a high kill shelter and is now living with a foster where she has enchanted all who meet her with her quiet gentleness, her exceptional manners (leash trained! house trained! knows her basic commands!) and her devotion to any person who shows her the least amount of love. We are hoping you might be able to show her endless amounts of love, forever. How could you look into those eyes and say no? We're betting that if you meet her, you won't be able to!
name: Niala

description:
âGorgeous Rebecca waited patiently in her kennel, came forward to be leashed and stepped quietly out for a walk.  Going potty as soon as we were out the door tells me she's housetrained, and she looked up at me waiting for her "good girl" and a "good girl" treat which of course she got!  She's fabulous on leash and I thoroughly enjoyed my walk with her - it was definitely saving the best for last.  A small yappy dog pulled towards us and Rebecca graciously ignored him, looking up at me as if to say - cute guy but noisy, huh?!  In her first group Rebecca greeted the helper dog appropriately and then wandered off to explore the pen.   She happily greeted another dog through the fence, clearly wanting to meet and play.  Rebecca is unique and gorgeous - her long, elegant, slim neck calls out to be a neckpiece model, and her cute little ears frame her eyes which are intelligent, soft and speak of a gentle nature.  She gets playfully silly and bouncy for a moment, and then joins me on the bench for some petting and kisses.  Rebecca was scared during her behavior assessment, especially during the tag portion.  I pet and tapped her all over and had no issues with her.  She'll need a quiet, gentle approach, a soft voice and easy hand and is ready to prove to you what an awesome companion she can be.  I fell in love with her, she has my heart, and know that you will too.
Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet her!
name: Rebecca

description:
Bio coming soon, please email for more info!

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him
name: Polo

description:
He likes cats!!!!! He has lived with small children! He gets along happily with other dogs! We all know it's difficult to check off these boxes off when adopting a rescue dog, so may we introduce you to the check-all-the-boxes-off wonder that is JD, a gorgeous, 1 year old Lab/Pit mix who is just waiting for a cat, dog, kid-filled home to call his own! Rescued from a high-kill shelter he is living with a foster who has such faith in him that he is already in training to surpass his basic commands, because this dog is going to go out there into the world and be a diplomat for all rescue dogs. Not to mention all sentient beings, given his ability to love 'em all. Please, won't you give him a chance to show off his tricks? The most important one being his generous loving with everyone and everything he meets. There could be no better way to start or end the day than snuggles from JD.

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: JD

description:
Honey Bear is ready to play! This dear, gentle dog is in a foster home waiting for a family who will romp with him--he loves small children, maturer folks, and all ages in between. He is equally lovely with other dogs. In other words, a perfectly-named, perfect pup. He's smart (he knows his basic commands and is house trained), and has a wonderful sense of humor--what more could one possibly look for in a companion of any kind? All that Honey Bear is missing is his forever playmates. Please, don't ask him to wait any longer!

Please email mbwambwa@icloud.com to meet him!
name: Honey Bear

description: Cookie is a 6 year old, black & white baby girl, who comes to us from a local municipal shelter. Cookie came into the shelter after her owner moved away and left her outside. Thankfully, the neighbors call the shelter to come pick her up. Cookie waited for her chance at a forever home for over THREE LONG YEARS inside the shelter walls, until see finally made it to her foster home. It breaks our hearts that she was over looked for so long, but we feel her luck changing! Cookie is 100% house broken, and crate trained. Cookie loves to be the mommy to puppies and kittens who she has met over the years. Cookie will need very slow, and proper introductions to other dogs, and she would much prefer males. We are recommending Cookie not go home with children, as as she is wary of strangers. It takes time for people to gain Cookie's trust, but once you do, she becomes a MUSH of a dog. Please consider opening your home to the girl who has been over looked for her entire life. Please email friends@projectpetinc.org to find out how to meet this deserving girl.
name: Cookie

description: Easter has been so beloved since she was rescued from a high kill shelter that the volunteers who got to know her there still ask for updates from her foster! And what a delight it is to give those updates for this kind, sweet 2 year-old girl, who is described by more than one person as "soulful" She is definitely that, but she is also wiggly, silly, affectionate, and an all-around dear heart who loves playing with other dogs, snuggling, showing off her beautiful training, and being praised. Please, won't you join us in singing her praises and consider doing so on a daily basis by offering her a forever home? Easter is a reason to celebrate, and she is looking for a reason to do the same!
name: Easter

description: Dianna came into NYC kill shelters extremely emaciated and in terrible condition. Dianna is currently getting better in a foster home, and is looking for her forever home. Please contact us to meet this amazing, resilent, sweet, loving girl!
name: Dianna

description: Bio coming soon for this chunky monkey!
name: Aviator Gator

description: Bio coming soon for this cutie patootie!
name: Hunter

description: Ashby is the most adorable dog you'll ever see! Please message us to meet him!
name: Ashby

description: This little cutie, is AMAZING! Please check back for a full bio, but in the meantime, please contact us to meet this awesome boy!
name: Alejandro

description: Herschel and Beatrix were adopted together when they were just babies, forming a sibling bond with each other. They love to groom each other and nap together. Herschel is an easy going boy, who loves his people and adopted sister. Both cats are fully vetted. For more information please email: Info@rescuenyc.org
name: Herschel

description: Beatrix & Herschel adopted each other when they were tiny babies! They love to be with each other and their humans.  Beatrix is a very inquisitive kitty who helps Herschel feel confident in new settings. She is VERY affectionate and always wants to be around you or sitting on your lap. If you are looking for a cat to keep you company... ask about Beatrix! She is fully vetted. For more information email: Info@rescuenyc.org
name: Beatrix

description:
Kiddy has spent all of her life in a loving home with children and her doggy brother. She is a gentle cat who enjoys giving head rubs to those she loves, being in her cat tree and just passing the day with some toys and naps. Kiddy would do well in most homes and is fully vetted/healthy.
For more information on this beauty, email: Info@rescuenyc.org
name: Kiddy

description:
Grey is an outgoing and social guy who loves to be doing whatever his human or animal friends are involved with! Grey was found by a good Samaritan who than reached out to RescueNYC for help with placement. He would make a great addition to any home that is looking for a cuddly, playful, and extremely cute feline. He is healthy and will be neutered in the next few weeks.

For more information please email: Info@rescuenyc.org
name: Grey

description:
Huggable Panda Kitty
Elvis is a friendly house cat that I found abandoned in a desolate area during January's record blizzard.

Elvis is distinctive in that --Not only is he a laid back cat he does not scratch furniture or cat scratchers!!!!!

He is a big teddy bear. He loves to be picked up and hugged, and purrs loudly. The vet estimates his age between 5-9 years old.
He is a super gentle and laid back cat. When I found him I jumped out of the car and picked him right up. He calmly sat in my arms on the way home. Despite his awful abandonment, he is friendly and has a heart of gold. He loves to be petted and purrs strongly. He is currently living with other cats but would rather be a Solo cat. Elvis is a mellow fellow and super low maintenance --he has excellent litter box habits and is not a fussy eater. He is healthy and tests negative to FIV/ FeLV. Elvis was found neutered and has all his vaccines. If you would like to meet him, in Brooklyn, Manhattan, or Staten Island please contact jensenmania@gmail.com.
There is a small adoption fee to cover vetting, and an adoption application.

7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Elvis

description:
Soft, gentle lap cat seeking long term relationship with cuddly human. My name is Marley and I am tired of an endless series of casual meetings with strangers. I am ready to settle down in a stable, forever home and devote myself to one or two good people.

I am five years old and have been through some upheavals, lately. Born in an outdoor feral cat colony in Ditmas Park and rescued as a kitten, I was recently left by my owner of five years. I was somewhat traumatized when I landed at Brooklyn Cat Cafe, but after some time hanging out UNDER the couches I discovered it was cooler to hang out ON the couches and meet people. It turned out to be even cooler to sit in their laps (including Santa's!) Boy, do I like to snuggle up to somebody and get some lovin! I am starting to get a bit of a paunch and if you make a point of it, I might even get into some cat toys for a little exercise now and then.

Unfortunately, I was not thrilled with all those annoying other cats at the Cat Cafe, so I went to a foster, who then had to travel. I am trying things out with another nice lady, but she won't commit. So if you're ready for a sweet, devoted, faithful companion, give me a call! Or email that is... 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Marley

description:
Look at beauty Leila, mother extraordinaire, who was rescued from an abandoned church in Brooklyn with her four kittens! All of her kittens have now been adopted and Leila sits and ponders when her forever family is coming!! She is a little shy, but snuggles with her foster family and is healthy, sweet and a true beauty!! Wanna meet Leila?! Email us to schedule a time and fall in love!

Info@bighandslittlepaws.org
7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Leila

description:
Who wants to play??!! Well, I am Sebastian and I will play with anyone and (almost) anything! I also having amazing jumping abilities â probably from the part Bengal in me â and can pull down any wand toy, no matter how high you swing it!I am 3 1/2 years old. About 2 years ago, I was dumped at the NYC Animal Care & Control in Manhattan and was almost immediately placed on that dreaded list. I am not sure why, but think it was because I came down with a respiratory infection. Thankfully, Big Hands Little Paws rescued me, helped me feel better, and even got me neutered (yikes!) and micro-chipped.I also have been having lots of my fun with my foster family, which includes a house full of humans and other cats, but I really, really want to find a forever family.

Sometimes I have trouble telling the difference between play and prey so I think I would do best as an only cat and probably not with children. The members at BHLP think I would do best with an experienced cat parent. Iâm cool with that since I want someone who can teach and show me a few new things. And, I am a quick learner: I know how to sit for treats (hint! hint!). I am FIV/FELV negative, neutered and micro-chipped, and am all ready to âjumpâ into your armsâ¦

Please catch me and take me home?

For more information or to meet Sebastian in Brooklyn, please contact Pamela Goldsmith/Big Hands Little Paws - pamela@bighandslittlepaws.org or complete an application at
http://bighandslittlepaws.org/cat-adoption-application/ 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Sebastian

description: Charlie and Felix are best friends and brothers who are a little over a year old. Charlie doesn't have a mean bone in his body - his foster mom says that he is the sweetest cat she's ever met! He sneaks into bed in the morning to cuddle and ask for breakfast :) He enjoys playing laser tag, watching birds from the window and cuddling and wrestling with his brother. Felix is gentle and shy. He needs patience and lots of love to feel comfortable, and he will come to you when he is ready. His warm expression shows that he cares and appreciates you. If these bonded brothers accidentally end up in separate rooms, it won't be long before one is calling out for the other. Charlie and Felix are FIV/FeLV negative, fully vaccinated and neutered. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Charlie & Felix

description:
Kitney Houston is a small, seven-year old domestic short hair with beautiful calico coloring. She hails from Brooklyn, where she was adopted three years ago.
Unfortunately, Kitney's owner could no longer keep her and asked a friend to care for her.

She is incredibly sweet and friendly with people but she prefers to be the only pet in the home. Her interests including licking people, taking cat naps and looking out the window. She's a very easy-going, low-maintenance companion with an affectionate disposition.

7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Kitney Houston

description: Simon is a handsome and confused sweetheart. He can be a bit shy at first, but loves to be near the action. He is obsessed with laser pointers (and any sort of light reflection) and puts on quite a show. At times he's very playful and active with toys, at other times he prefers to stretch out and just be handsome. Simon needs a friendly and playful companion - if possible a cat, but he's also very interested in dogs. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Simon

description:
Evie is a chatty and petite kitty with soft black fur and big green eyes. While she is shy around strangers, she is a loving cat who adores attention. Evie wants to sleep next to you every night, and is very talkative when treats are involved! She also loves catnip, fishing pole toys, and warm window sills.

Evie is 8 years old, spayed, vaccinated, FIV/FeLV negative, and microchipped. She would love to be a single girl in a quiet home, but could also live with a friendly male who respected her personal space. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Evie

description: Playful Yuki is a little over a year, but is still full of kitten! He is skittish of meeting new people, but loves all cats and would like to go to a home with at least one other playful cat and patient people who will help him get comfortable. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Yuki

description: Sweet and affectionate Maddie was found in a backyard with her two kittens. This tiny young lady would be happy in a home all to herself where she can shower you with all of her love and affection. Maddie is around a year old, fully vaccinated and spayed. She has some dietary restrictions which are very easy to manage, ask us for more info. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Maddie

description:
BooBoo is a friendly, big, and fluffy boy who adores sunny windowsills and soft blankets. He lost his home when his previous owner left town and dumped him at the city pound. Thankfully, a kind volunteer reached out to us for help, and BooBoo was wisked to a foster home for safety.

BooBoo adores attention and he is a social cat. Hanging out next to his favorite humans and snacking on wet food is bliss. Heâs an avowed couch potato, but cannot resist a fishing pole toy dangled in his direction. BooBoo is OK with other laid back cat and dogs too!

BooBoo is 12 years old. He is neutered, vaccinated, FIV/FeLV negative and microchipped. Our vet did a full senior profile during his visit (including blood exam and dental check), and gave him an excellent review! Please email BrooklynBridgeAnimals@yahoo.com to arrange a play date in his Windsor Terrace foster home. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: BooBoo

description: Quatro is a quirky, fearless, little tortie that is a constant source of entertainment and fun. She loves to wrestle and chase play with toys or whatever is available. When she finally tires out, she looks for an available lap to fall asleep on, but if there isn't one available, a pile of shoes is also a favorite. Quatro is full of personality, with a squeak rather than a proper meow and will love to get to know you. She would like to be adopted with one of her friends at the cafe or into a home with an age-appropriate playmate. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Quatro

description: Trusty is a true gentleman - and also a major snuggler. At eight years old, this brown and white tabby enjoys curling up on and next to his favorite humans. Trusty would be happy to be your one and only, but doesn't mind other calm cats. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Trusty

description: Tiger is a sweet and affectionate 11 year old handsome fellow. He prefers a quiet home (no kids or rowdy animals, please) and would love to curl up right next to you and watch some good (or bad) TV. His fosters say that Tiger meets them at the door every night and can't wait to spend time together. Tiger would be a fine companion with another calm cat or would be happy alone. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Tiger

description: Gorgeous Toesey is a friendly and outgoing black cat with two white toes and a locket on her chest. She enjoys spending time with her favorite humans and sunbathing in the window. She wouldn't mind being an only cat, but would also be fine as a companion to a friendly and quiet adult cat. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Toesey

description: Lito is a friendly, chatty, and playful cat who adores everyone! His favorite activities are chasing his toys, hanging out on top of his favorite cat tree, and snuggling with his humans. He would love to live in a social household, and have another active male kitty or cat-loving dog to play with. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Lito

description: An incredibly sweet and shy orange tabby boy, Patrick Henry enjoys strokes and attention. He enjoys playing, being pet, and watching the action around him â as well as jumping in for a good game of soccer amongst his kitty pals. Patrick is somewhat introverted, but not skittish or fearful and would thrive in a home with another kitty. He is an easy going and handsome boy, who will continue to come out of his shell as he adapts to his new home and would be a kind and calm companion to children. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Patrick Henry

description: Garfunkel is a thoughtful and handsome gentleman. Changes are stressful for him and have inspired periods of hibernation, but once he feels safe, he enjoys hanging out with and near his friends. He loves to stare out the window and contemplate life. Garfunkel would be overjoyed to be adopted with his former roommate, Simon, but would be flexible as long as he has a friendly companion. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Garfunkel

description: Snowball is an adorable white cat with beautiful green eyes. Snowball would prefer to be a single cat, but she would be able to adjust to being with another cat who gives her space. Very intelligent, Snowball is cuddly but also knows how to give you space if you work from home. She's the type of cat that is waiting for you by the door as you get home and prefers to snuggle up on your chest at night. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Snowball

description: This is one chill cat, comfortable with everyone - Burton is your go-to guy. He was the mayor of his housing projects, friend to man and beast, everyone knew and loved him - children, dogs, and other cats. He was just too sweet to be left outside - he deserves a real home with people who appreciate him! He's ready to join your family! 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Burton

description: Rescued as a frightened starving feral kitten in a back alley on Halloween in 2015, Jack took a long time to trust his human friends, but is now chief headbutt-er and kitchen supervisor at his foster location! An enthusiastic investigator and hunter, he also likes cat toys, cardboard boxes, and sisal scratchers. He will let you know when he's ready for affection and then loves LOTS of petting. He doesn't mind being touched all over, but he is not yet comfortable with being picked up. Jack is neutered, vaccinated, and FIV/FelV negative. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Jack

description: Masumi is a very sweet but shy girl, who just loves to play, explore, and investigate! While she does not completely trust humans yet, a patient soul who can give her space and time will soon win her over, especially if you have some fresh chicken to share! Her big round eyes will watch everything you do; she'll sniff your shoes and sit close to you. She loves her brother Yuki, but would likely be happy with another cat companion as well. Masumi is spayed, vaccinated, FiV/FeLV negative and microchipped. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Masumi

description: Sasha is a sweet, gentle soul with gorgeous green eyes and shiny jet black fur. Sasha would like to be adopted either with her true love, Suzy BQE. Sasha has rather severe food allergies that are very easy to manage now that we know what works for her. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Sasha

description: Sappho is an extremely affectionate tortie who doesnât want to be touched. What? That doesnât make sense to you? Us either. Sappho follows her foster mom EVERYWHERE and is super snuggly in theory, just not in practice - she greets her at the door and constantly rubs up on her legs, but in general would prefer not to be touched by a human hand. Sappho is a very special girl and would be a wonderful companion to patient humans who will give her some time to feel comfortable. Sappho would love to live with another friendly cat! She is between 2 and 3 years old, fully vaccinated and spayed. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Sappho

description: Sweet and shy Suzy BQE was rescued off the BQE (see how clever we are with names?) last year and required emergency and extensive surgery. Suzy is very shy, but loves to be pet on her own terms and is head over heels for her BFF, Sasha. Suzy has the softest fur and hops around like a bunny. 7/8/18 4:06 PM
name: Suzy BQE

description:
Willamenia is a rescue cat. She is approximately 3 years old. She has all of her shots (just recently updated in July) and is spayed and tested negative for FIV/FeLV. 

Willemenia is very sweet when alone and all is quiet. However, she would be much happier in a home with no children and no other pets.   

She makes good use of a scratching post.

Her current family has found that the arrival of a baby has brought a change in Willemenia's gentle soul, and her fear of the strange little one has done her an injustice.  As much as the family adores her, it is clear that their cat would b happier elsewhere.
name: Willemenia

description:
Lina, the all-black beauty, and Meadow, the lovely grey tiger with white accents, are a sweet pair of brothers who had a rough time. They were very sick when we rescued them from grave risk at the shelter, but are all a-ok now.  They had horrible eye infections, and there is a little bit of corneal scarring, but they've healed and hare healthy fellows. Lina is likely blind (hard to tell as cats adapt), and may have a mild neurological issue that makes him circle at times.  

The boys have been in foster care, but they have to leave that home soon.
The boys are about 2 years old, neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.
If you're looking for a lovely pair of bonded cats, look hard at these two.

Please go to K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and carefully follow the instructions to download, save, complete and save again  our application to e-mail back to us.
name: Lina and Meadow

description:
Ok, so they're not chipmunks.  They are definitely kittens, but were singing away for Christmas time just like the chipmunk boys.

The boys have been adopted, while sweet Simone remains waiting for a home.she is  delightful, friendly, engaging and will never jump on your table, counter, or anywhere, in fact.  Simone gets around, but needs a very, very low litter box. She would probably do best with a wee wee pad holder rather than a box to get into. She sometimes acts out a bit and uses something strewn on the floor instead of her box.  Otherwise, she's like any other cat--just more adorable and laudable for her efforts to be a typical cat.  She  has a condition called Cerebellar Hypoplasia, which is a neurological condition resulting from a pre-natal infection.  It does no impair her health or longevity, but it does make her cuter than you can imagine.  She wobbles and tumbles at times, but she's just fine that way--she thinks it's normal.  "CH" cats are playful, love people, and  are known for their stellar personalities.

Now an adult, she is in foster care in NJ, and are spayed/neutered.  

NEW!  Now you can download an application from our new website, K9Kastle.org, complete it on your computer and e-mail it back to the address on the computer.  Just download, fill out, SAVE and e-mail back, telling us in your e-mail which pets you are interested in.  If you have a mac, it won't save once filled out, but you can print, scan and e-mail back, or just fax to the number on the application.
name: The Chipmunks... Simone is now singing solo!

description:
Charlie is an enigma.  He's a delight, happy-go-lucky fellow of about 4 who will charm the pants off you.  He is playful, affectionate, and has grown to be fine with cats.  He also lives with a dog in his foster home.  

Charlie previously had some personality quirks that were puzzling.  We have fixed that with a little pill daily--prozac!  Generic, of course, it is the savior of many cats who are total mushes but have unpredictable moments.

Charlie is now completely predictable, and the predictions are all good.

He is neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

Please go to K9Kastle.org, click on "Adopt," and follow the instructions carefully to download and submit our application.
name: Charlie

description:
We simply cannot get a photo of either o them alone, because they are never alone! Nestle and Crunch were found as strays, and now are the most affectionate, attached, playful, happy young cats of about a year.  They are perfect in their manners and perfect in their habits and simply perfect.

Nestle is the larger one, with the white nose.

If you'd like to see what they think of themselves and one another, check out their blog page at:   https://k9kastle.wordpress.com/2015/04/03/foster-feature-friday-nestle-crunch/

They are altered, vaccinated and fev/fiv negative.

You can download our application at K9Kastle.org. Click on "adopt" and carefully follow the instructions to complete on your computer.
name: Nestle and Crunch

description:
True to his name, 3 year old  Buddy is the perfect companion cat. While you're at work, he'll spend his leisure time bird watching on the windowsill or sleeping in his favorite bed. When you come home he'll be the first to greet you, with a meow and some head butts. During dinner Buddy will respect your spaceâ¦ as long as he gets a taste when you're having his favorite: refried beans! He loves chasing toy mice and batting around stuffed fish to let off some steam before settling down for some cheek scratches and belly rubs during TV time.  

Besides his charming personality and silky soft coat, Buddy stands out for his gentle nature. It's hard to put into words, but he has an ease about him that every veterinarian, rescuer and foster has made note of. As you get to know him, you too will grow to understand what a special cat Buddy is. 

Details
- 3 years old, neutered male cat
- FIV/FeLV negative, vaccinated and microchipped
- Good with cats and dogs, would do best in a home with another pet


NOTES (from interview with his foster mom)

Does he have a favorite toy?
â¢	Mouse on the wire, very active -- chases and jumps, rolls on back, kicks at it
â¢	Stuffed fish, bats them around, rolls around

Favorite food?  
â¢	Freeze dried treats
â¢	Likes all food
â¢	Likes refried beans, tries to steal 

Does he do anything to get your attention? 
â¢	Runs up and headbutts, follows around house
â¢	Welcomes home by running up and meowing
â¢	Otherwise quiet

What kind of attention does he like?
â¢	Belly rubs
â¢	Cheek scratches, & behind the ear
â¢	Loves being brushed
â¢	Not really a cuddler
â¢	Doesn't like to be picked up, kicks but not with claws out

Where does he sleep?
â¢	On the couch or chair or in his bed

How is he with visitors? 
â¢	Used to be shy but now comes out to greet them, allows petting
â¢	Really well behaved around another cat

Other personality traits
â¢	Loves to birdwatch on the windowsill

What is your favorite thing about him? 
â¢	Very sweet & gentle, would never hurt anyone
â¢	Handsome face, distinguished 
â¢	Silky coat
name: Buddy

description:
Pippa is the funniest, most vocal girl!  She loves a good cuddle, but is also content with a pillow in a cubby (that's her favorite spot!)  She's great with other cats.  Pippa is very wobbly.   She was born with cerebellar hypoplasia (a harmless, not health-impairing neurological condition) and will always need some management.  The good news is, it doesn't stop her from living a full and happy life.  She's a little messy with her canned food (she doesn't drink much water, so she needs wet food for hydration) and exclusively uses her playpen as her litter box (with a wee wee pad inside).  She's just a love!  Pippa is about a year, spayed, vaccinated, tested and microchipped


Please to go K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and carefully follow the instructions to download, save, complete, save again and return the applicatoin.
name: Pippa

description:
If you like bright and sunny, if you like calm and gentle, and if you're one of those people who has that special gift of embracing special needs, please check out this 1 year old honey.  

As you can see in the photos, he has fared quite well in boarding--the last shot, sitting up, shows how thin he was upon rescue, and the other two, well--he's just right!

Our San Juan came in to Manhattan's city shelter as a stray. His tail wasn't working--it was just there, injured, having suffered nerve damage. The tail was amputated, but the nerve damage was a little more far reaching: San Juan wasn't able to urinate on his own, and the urine had to be expressed twice daily so as not to allow toxins to back up as well as for comfort.   HOWEVER...he has healed, and this issue is gone.  One in a while, he poops outside of the box, but we think this may be because of his multi-cat environment.  

His behavior is "beginner"--which means he's easy to handle, affectionate and friendly.  He is really a lovely boy.

San Juan is vaccinated and felv/fiv negative. He will be neutered shortly.


For an application, please go to: K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and follow the instructions to download, complete and return the application.
name: San Juan

description:
Simone, along with brothers Alvin and Theodore, was rescued as a tiny kitten and have been fostered by  wonderful woman who, of course, caved and has adopted Alvin.  Theodore has been adopted too, gbut Simone would be pleased to have a home to call permanent, too.

All three were born with a condition called cerebellar hypoplasia, resulting from an infection in the part of the brain that manages motor function.  As you can see in the video, they have no clue that anything is wrong. They use the litter box, eat (even if a bit messy) and play like normal cats--because they are!  Simone is picky, however, and will use something other than litter box at times. Her condition will not worsen, and is not health or life-threatening, though she cannot be in a home with stairs.  She also won't be jumping on your counter.
She about 2 1/2 years old.

You can go to our website at K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and carefully follow the instructions for downloading, saving, completely, saving again and returning the application.
name: Simone

description:
COURTESY POST:
These two lovable house cats have been recently abandoned and are living on the street. They need a good foster home or an adoption, and this neighbor is willing to help pay the bills.
The two, recently abandoned house cats are clearly related, but thereâs also a third young grey one that is more shy and might be feral. The rescuer spoke to someone on the block who said that the owner of the two house cats had recently moved.

The cats are now living outside and people in the neighborhood have put food out for them but it is very close to the streets. The rescuer has too many rescued animals to foster them, but they need a temporary (or permanent) home while we can go through the right process to get them adopted. 

Please contact Sandy at Sandydragon1@yahoo.com
name: Lush and Lovely

description:
Archie came to us in late February when he showed up on the at-risk list.  He had a urinary tract blockage and one of our generous vets kept him till he was sure that it was resolved.  Archie MUST remain on his special diet, which is a crystal-deterrent. If the crystals recur, they may require surgery. Archie is really worth it.
	Archie was worth waiting for.  Sweet, cooperative, friendly, and full of love and affection. However, that is primarily for people. He really wants to be an only pet. He may do best with older children, not young ones.
	Archie is neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative. He is about 2 years old.



PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Archie

description:
Clyde was trapped in a feral colony, but it most certainly not  feral cat.  In fact, he is a gem--a happy-go-lucky fellow who would love to live with you and you young, playful cat.  Clyde has that kind of youthful exuberance that we humans simply cannot keep up with or engage.  But with another friendly, youthful companion who prefers chasing invisible mice to sleeping 24/7, he will be in his own heaven.

He is 1 year old, neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Santa Clyde--ho ho ho

description:
This lovely 10 year old ended up at the city shelter. At some time in her life, she was an outdoor colony catâshe is ear-tipped, meaning trapped, spayed and likely released.  However, to make up for the loss of her ear tip (no big deal), she has some extra toes!

	She was initially afraid at the shelter, but nonetheless calm, friendly, vocal and attention-seeking. In fact, she allowed petting all over. She used the litter box appropriately, too.

	Capân Crunch is apparently healthy, with no known illness, but she has come to us with dental disease. She will have a dental shortly, and will be all the happier after.

	She is spayed, vaccinated, and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Cap'n Crunch

description:
Gumball is a super-sweet cat who has expressed that she wants to be your one and only.  Her behavior assessment, below, is stellar.  When the assessor came:

Gumball was by the front, looking around and is calm and relaxed.
Gumball rubs her head and body against the cage door, soliciting attention when spoken to.
Gumball remains soft and relaxed when the cage door is opened.
Gumball head-butts, starts to knead and begins to purr.  She rubs her entire body on the assessor and continues to solicit attention, walking back and forth from the back to the front when picked up, and remains calm and continues to purr when held.
	There isnât much else to say!
       Gumball has  a heart murmur. There is not treatment required at this time. In fact, she went through her spay surgery with flying colors.

	If you have another cat, please read our instructions for introducing them properly.

Gumball is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.



PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Gumball

description:
Jackie is a really lovely 7 year old who was surrendered to the shelter by her life-long owner because of litter box issues. While nervous upon her intake exam, she proved to be a stellar cat with the behavior specialist:
Jackie immediately comes soliciting at the front of the cage when approached, Jackie remains standing at the front of the cage, relaxed body posture, soliciting attention when the door is opened. Jackie head-butts the assessor's hand and appreciates petting on the head and body when petted. She
Jackie is easily picked up and remains calm.
Jackie interacts with the Assessor, solicits attention, is easy to handle and tolerates all petting. This cat can go to a beginner home.
Jackieâs owner reported she was going outside the litter boxâand noted she âplays exuberantly with all the cats.â She likely did not have enough litter boxes for âall the cats.â  Please see enclosed information on this issue.  She has been fine in boarding. 
	Jackie is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.


For an application, please go to: K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and follow the instructions to download, complete and return the application.
name: Jackie

description:
Chelsea was thought to be about 5 years old at the shelter, though they also called her a âsenior.â No offense taken, she says, just treat me like the queen I am. 

	Chelsea had what was thought to be a healing fracture in early July, but she is fine now. The shelter noted that she was âvery easy to examine, shaved belly to check for spay scar tattoo. No hissing or growling even when examining for lameness. Calm even on leash.â (note: the leash was so they could examine her while walkingâno need to leash a cat because there is no need to take them out!)

	In the end, they gave this girl a âbeginnerâ behavior rating the best there is. She is spayed, vaccinate and felv/fiv negative.


For an application, please go to: K9Kastle.org, click on "adopt," and follow the instructions to download, complete and return the application.
name: Chelsea

description:
This sweet 7 year old came to us with Mama, also found here on Petfinder.  She was actually adopted by us years ago, and somehow ended up back at the shelter with her housemate, as the owner had "too many cats."  We can't help but wonder which cats she kept.

Despite being surrendered, likely for her age, Bella is still the sweet good sport she always was, though may take a bit of time to warm up.  After all, she has been there, done that, and look where she ended up.

She is a lovely girl, with no known health issues, and will make a fine companion.
This cat is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.


PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Bella

description:
Biggie is a three year old exotic/domestic long haired mix girl who has faced and emerged from some challenges. She tells us at each event that she doesn't want to be in a cage, but instead would like to be in a home where she can trust in her caregiver family. She is not aggressive at all, and is really sweet, but she has had it with being a shelter cat. She needs an experienced cat person, and no young children of whom of whom it is not fair to have any expectation of being respectful to her needs.

If you look at her photos, the first is the day she was surrendered, and she was surprised but not unpleasant or unhappy.  She has moved on to expressing her wish to be "home" with a sadness we hope to remedy soon.

This cat is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.


PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Biggie

description:
We pulled 6 year old Saturday on the recommendation of the New Hope personnel at one of the city shelters.  

When evaluated, he was found to be soliciting attention, head-butting for more petting, and particularly liked to be petted on the head and body.  Saturday will allow you to pick him up, but will not stay in your arms long, jumping down when he is ready.  He is described to be mellow, shy, sweet and curious.  In fact, the assessor gave him the best rating: Beginner, meaning that even a first time cat owner would be fine with him.

We think he has been with us too long, and don't think that he should be with small children, as he shuts down and will not respond well to poking and the like.  However, he remains a sweet cat and once in a home and not a cage, will blossom. (He loves being out of his cage at his boarding facility.).
This cat is neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Saturday

description:
Gentle sweet older by, Salem is moderately impaired with a neurological birth defect (cerebellar hypoplasia, or CH) that causes him to stumble quite a bit.  He gets where he needs to go, but sometimes needs some help with stability.  He can't jump or do stairs, but he LOVES to cuddle and will drool with pleasure when receiving (and giving!) affection.  He follows you around quietly, although he does sometimes like to chat.  He uses a litter box with low or no front or wee wee pads.  Neutered, vaccinated, tested (negative) and microchipped.

Of course, any other pet he is with has to be friendly and gentle, as Salem's defenses are limited.

This cat is neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Salem

description:
Brooklyn and Neb were adopted from us as kittens, but returned to us due to their adopter's finances and relocation.  This bonded pair are sweet mature cats who need a home with lots of love.  Neb (the older one, black)is outgoing and a real lap cat.  He loves belly rubs and loves to sleep on top of you.  Brooklyn (tortie) is more skeptical, but also demands attention when Neb isn't hogging it all.  They have lived with another cat, would be great with children but dogs are an unknown:  Neb would probably do fine, Brooklyn might not.  Brooklyn and Neb are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, felv/fiv negative, and microchipped.  Neb needs a special diet.  Several years ago he had an issue with FLUTD, but has been asymptomatic since being on a urinary diet (Hill's C/D).  

These cast are neutered.spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Brooklyn and Neb

description:
They were born from a Feral mother our volunteers  trapped back in May. Sylvester and Marce  are about 10 months old, and love to play together, showing great, high energy. 

Sylvester is very sweet once he gets to know you. He loves to be petted, and is all over his foster mom.  .

Marce, too, is  sweet, but she needs an experienced owner, who will understand that coming over to play or cuddle must be HER decision, not the owner's. Petting, too, is much appreciated--but at Marce's request.

Neither of them enjoys being picked up, so it's best to leave that for when it's really necessary, like annual vet visits. (On the other hand, you can see in their photos that they were not squirmy, angry or uncomfortable.)

Marce and Sylvester should be the only two pets in the house.

Marce is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.
Sylvester is neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Sylvester and Marce

description:
Some know all-too-well how big girls can be wrongly overlookedâbut please, donât pass up this one. Rhea, who was close to 16 pounds when rescued, offers her lucky adopter sweet, but timid, cat companionship. She will warm up in your home as she has in our home-like boarding facility.  She is not aggressive, and has lived with cats in boarding.  

	Rhea has a moderate heart murmur, but perhaps a carefully monitored diet will help that. We had an echocardiogram done, and she requires no treatment or medication. She came to us with a typical shelter cold, and is now fine.

	Rhea is 2 years old, vaccinated, felv/fiv negative., and  her spay surgery was uneventful.


PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Rhea

description:
Benny and Bongo are two sweet  year olds, adopted from us as kittens but now in need of a new home.  The first two photos are Benny, and the others are Bongo.

The boys have a condition acquired in utero called "cerebella hypoplasia," or "CH." It is not life-threatening, contagious, or harmful in any way, except it affects their motor skills. Take a look at the 2nd picture of Benny and see his wide stance with his back legs.  That is for balance, and these cats (all with CH) tend to cope beautifully.

These boys are loving and friendly. We don't have information about them with children and other pets, but most CH cats are just fine with all the above.

They are neutered, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

PLEASE GO TO K9KASTLE.ORG, CLICK ON "ADOPT," AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DOWNLOAD, SAVE, COMPLETE AND SAVE AGAIN OUR APPLICATION. RETURN IT TO THE E-MAIL ADDRESS OR FAX NUMBER AT THE TOP. THANK YOU!
name: Benny & Bongo

description:
Joanie is a delightful 4 year old who has been in foster care too long!  However, what we have learned about her  from her foster family is invaluable.  She is simply perfect:  she's friendly, wants to be with her person/people all the time, and wants to sleep with them, too.  She has lived with other cats, and now says "ENOUGH!  You just don't need anyone else if you have me."  Actually, she is right.  She doesn't mind being with a dog, but really prefers that she be your only cat.  

This cat is spayed, vaccinated and felv/fiv negative.

name: Joanie

description: Armstrong is a sweet and affectionate pup who would love nothing more than to play and snuggle all day! He has displayed guarding challenges and takes time to warm up to new people, so he would be suited for an experienced adult-only home outside of the city. With a confident leader, he feels more safe and secure and melts into a fluffy goofball. He loves going on long structured walks, running around with his foster siblings, and chasing toys. He may have short legs, but Armstrong is super athletic and loves to show off his agility by running around a big yard and jumping over obstacles. When he's all tuckered out, he'll curl up in his crate and relax. This smartypants has already mastered sit, down, paw, roll over, the "place command, and how to be well-behaved inside in his foster home and is learning more everyday. Armstrong would thrive with a family that will give him exercise, be diligent with professional training and boundaries, and of course show him lots of love. Armstrong requires a foster-to-adopt home and professional training sessions as determined by Muddy Paws Rescue. He would be best suited for an experienced adult-only home outside of NYC and would benefit from structured training post adoption. Armstrong is 3 years old, up to date on all age appropriate medical care, microchipped, and is fully grown at 30 pounds. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Armstrong

description: Foster Update: Gunner is a beautiful blonde with white coat and stunning ice blue eyes. He absolutely loves his den-like crate and will go inside without complaint when instructed. He is also housetrained. Outside, he has great stamina and enjoys walks with his human. He is making great progress at keeping it cool when he sees other dogs and horses. He is friendly and loving towards humans, including new adults and kids who want to pet him on the street. Due to his size and strength, he would do best living with a human who can confidently walk a big dog. Inside, our good boy is mellow. Previously, he has had a positive experience living with another dog. At home, he enjoys receiving belly rubs and neck scratches, napping in front of the AC, and playing with toys. Gunner is our first foster who knows how to properly play fetch, dropping the item when instructed! He also knows how to sit. He is an intelligent dog and we are confident that he will be able to learn many more tricks. Overall, he is a loving dog who just wants to be around people! We are excited to find his forever home. Gunner is a 3 year old Husky / German Shepherd mix. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care, microchipped, and is fully grown at 55 pounds. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Gunner

description: Niko is a super happy miniature pinscher mix, who can't wait to meet you! He loves being playful and his favorite activity is playing fetch. When he's not playing around, he loves showing affection and giving lots of hugs to people. He does great with other dogs inside the home, but is still working on dog introductions while on his leash, so may do best living in less busy areas. He also loves playing fetch and tug of war with his crinkly bear toy. He knows how to sit, paw, and look. He is completely house trained and is fine with being in his crate! Niko does get overwhelmed with children, so an adult-only home (or one with older children) will be great for him. Niko is the sweetest little guy, and we can't wait for him to find his forever home! Niko is a 1 year old Min Pin mix. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care, and microchipped. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Niko

description: Lenny is an 8-10 year old West Highland Terrier mix from Texas. He is up to date on all age appropriate medical care, microchipped, and is fully grown at 18 pounds. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Lenny

description: Foster Update: Geno is a shy pup and takes his time to come out of his shell, but once he does he is a very loving boy! He is discovering that he can play with toys, and also likes to play with his canine foster sister. Geno likes to hang out and nap in the crate during the day. It takes some time to get him to go outside, but once he is outside he follows the lead of his foster sister and enjoys his walks. Geno would LOVE to go to a home with another dog! While he is out he likes to say hi to everyone that passes him. Geno is almost completely housebroken and sleeps through the night in his crate. He walks very well on the leash. He is working on sit and almost has it down. This pup is the perfect dog and is just waiting for his family to find him! Geno is 6 months old, up to date on all age appropriate medical care, microchipped, and is currently 30 pounds. We anticipate he will be 55-60 pounds full grown. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Geno

description: Are you looking for a new best friend? We have the perfect sweet Oreo for you. Her foster mom says: "Oreo is such a sweet girl! She loves ham, long walks, laying in grass, cuddling while mom watches a movie, and saying hi to all of the people she sees on her walks. She walks so well on a leash, and even knows "wait and "let's go. She is still adjusting to life in the big city, and like so many New Yorkers, is not a huge fan of long flights of stairs. She's almost fully house trained, and sleeps perfectly in the crate overnight. Oreo loves her humans so much that she wants to be with them all the time. We're still working on Oreo to love her quiet alone time. She's just a sweet and happy pup who needs a forever home." Apply to adopt Oreo today! Oreo is a 7 month old lab mix from Kentucky. She is up to date on all age appropriate medical care, microchipped, currently weighs 28 pounds, and will likely be fully grown at approximately 40-45 pounds. This dog is available for adoption through Muddy Paws Rescue. If you're interested in adopting, the first thing you should do is fill out an adoption application at www.muddypawsrescue.org. We will be in touch with you within 7 days of receiving your application!
name: Oreo

This gorgeous 1-year-old fluffy tuxedo is a very sweet girl but super shy and needs a low key home with someone who ideally has other pets and shy cat experience or is okay with having a cat that prefers to be with other cats than to be with humans. Shes an angel, very gentle, but fearful and seems to thrive around other cats and dogs, and her first foster family says she was more comfortable with children than adults in general, so she would be fine in a home with respectful children. Waddles is a wonderful girl that needs the right home and a chance to find herself. 


INTERESTED IN ADOPTING THIS KITTY? Please submit an application at soicalteesnyc.org!

description: SPROUT is a 3 year old boxer boy that is 50lbs. He is your typical boxer boy! Slobbering all over town, playing with dogs, looking faces to lick and wags his tail at everyone passing by. He is housebroken, has a good amount of energy, but is not hyper and his markings are so COOL!! He is a good boy that would do best in a medium active home he can call his FUREVER!!!
name: SPROUT

description:
If Goofy was an actual dog, we imagine heâd look kind of like this one. Meet Triumph! (If you havenât yet.) She is starting to grow into her name with a little help from an extra special foster family! This hound mix is about 7 months old, shy but very loving, great with other pups, fast-learning, and would thrive in an outdoorsy home ideally in the âburbs or country because sheâs pretty jumpy around city noises and buzz. Sheâs about 30 lbs and is still finding her confidence but thrives with the right guidance and environment. Her foster mom says: âTriumph is such a friendly dog! She is great with my husband and follows him around everywhere. She is very smart and is learning âsit.â She is very treat and toy motivated and is not possessive of her food or any items. She loves blankets and anything soft! She will go on her back and do the cutest wiggle when shes laying on the couch. Triumph is THE best snuggler. She curls herself up in a little ball and lets you hold her until you fall asleep. She's a bit skittish outside with loud noises but we have been practicing walking outside and using positive reinforcement on our walks. She has improved even though it as only been a few days. She is not a noisy dog and can be pretty chill even though shes always down to play!â

Triumph would do best in an active household, where she can grow up to be the best hound for your family EVER... if Triumph sounds like the hound pup for you -- APPLY NOW

We suspect Vlad (who now answers to John) is a fairytale creature. He's too majestic and amazing to be a regular old dog (not that there's anything wrong with that). This shepherd mix is about 5 to 6 years old and 85 lbs. He is housebroken, walks well on a leash, and is super friendly with everyone and good with gentle kids! He's good with cats and small dogs, and he's a little picky with big dogs he meets but is fine with them when introduced properly -- he's just not a fan of dogs that get all up in his face. Vlad aka John is a great companion for walks and has good energy but is super melllow at home and mostly sleeps the day away. He has an adorable habit of nuzzling you with his snout when he wants affection, he hasn't experienced any separation anxiety or destructiveness in his foster home, and he is a great sleeper through the night. Vlad has an old injury in one of his hips that sometimes seems to bother him, but our vet said according to x-rays he just needs to take it easy on the exercise, and glucosamine might help. In general, he gets around fine though. He must be in a home out of the city because he is significantly more stresed in urban environemnts, and he loves long walks in nature. He also seems to really enjoy being with small dogs so maybe a small dog companion so he has his own pack.

description:
Black Jack is a very sweet companion who is always looking for some belly rubs and attention. He is 35 lbs, which is about double what he should be, but he is on a diet and improving every day! Black Jack is a 5-year-old Tibetan spaniel.

His foster mom says "Of the four fosters Iâve had in my care, Black Jack is the *sweetest*. He just wants loveâ¦ and human food which he cannot have because he has some weight to lose. He is super chill, mainly lounges, but is totally down for a walk whenever. When you sit on the floor, he will run to you and sit in front of you and patiently wait for a belly rub. He likes to tell us when someone is at the door, but besides that, heâs very quiet. The best partâ¦ he will do his business outside but is also totally weewee pad trained!â
name: Black Jack

Wilflower is a uniquely gorgeous girl. This 4-year-old tabby is about 13 lbs, and she was born with one cutely crinkled ear. She is shy at first, and it takes her a minute to warm up to a new place, but once she does she is super sweet and easy going, and she's good with other animals but also does fine as the only pet in the home as long as she's getting enough loving from her humans. Her foster mom says: "She's the sweetest cat ever. (: It took a while for her to get used to the apartment, but once she feels comfortable, she has become the sweetest and best behaved cat. She loves playing with her toys or anything she finds. She loves cuddles, she even comes over when she is called. She is very talkative as well. She gets up with us every morning, walk with us around the apartment with the sweetest meows. She will make the best pet once she is adopted!"

description: Basil is a super sweet lab mix, but kind of a scaredy cat. She's a year old, about 50 lbs, and came from a home where she was barely socialized -- she's jumpy around outdoor noises and can be shy in new situations, but she's super smart, very eager to trust, learns fast, and settles in well once she's had a day or two to chill out. She's great with small dogs on the calmer side but seems to be afraid of bigger dogs and pups that come at her with too much playful energy. She walks okay on a leash but could use some more time outside getting used to the sights and sounds. She's very playful, an awesome jogging partner, and a great cuddle companion indoors. Basil would do best in an active home ideally out of the city or in a quiet neighborhood where she can get a slower introduction to the wide world around her. She would get along great with another chill smaller dog for a buddy who can guide the way. Her foster dad says: "This is our 6th time fostering. Basil was kind of a mess when I first picked her up, but she is a really quick leaner. She went from peeing the in house to only peeing outside in 2 days. She can be shy in public and startles easily, but definitely very curious and I see her warming up to other dogs, other people and the outside world pretty fast. I keep her away from dogs that are larger than her to help her confidence. She seems to be afraid of the crate as well, but we're working on that too. At home she is very playful and loving -- definitely a snuggler! She has a lot of energy which I think is normal for labs especially a 1 year old. I run with her a couple miles every day. She's a great running buddy! Doesn't pull that much. I see her as a diamond in the ruff right now. With a little TLC and training she will be a great dog." Interested in adopting? Submit an application at socialteesnyc.org!
name: Basil

What a lady. Pepper is a green eyed seductress with an exotic torbie coat -- flecks of gold catch the sunlight and shine like fish scales when she sits in the rays pouring through the window. Her name doesn't quite fit this mysterious, hypnotizing animal. She should be an Anastasia or a Vanessa or a Sapphire. Pepper is about 10 years old, 12 lbs, and she's very friendly, social, and eager to receive cheek scratches. She's easy going and seems good with other animals so far, though she's pretty new to us so we are stil learning. She has a tipped ear, which indicates that she was found stray, spayed, and returned to the streets where she was found by some animal loving TNR group at some point in her past. Hard to imagine such a regal, affectionate kitty on the streets -- we're so glad she made her way to us.
